name: barry&mandy tuttle
text: I took my car in for a windshield replacement and noticed that the rear view mirror cover was damaged in the process. Nobody said anything to me about it, they just tried to get it back in place but it kept falling down. When I called to report it, they said they would order another one and replace it when I took my car in for its next oil change. When that time came, my husband took the morning off and drove  the car the hour and a half drive it takes to get to this dealership. My husband was told the rear view mirror cover had been replaced but when I got my car back, I noticed it had NOT been replaced. I called the service department and was told that it had indeed been replaced. When I inquired as to how the service tech then managed to break TWO covers and not mention it, I was told they would need to get back to me. When they called me back, I was told the the part had never actually been ordered and that they would order it and ship it to my house so I could replace it myself. This is not the first time I have had issues with dishonesty when dealing with the service department at this dealership. I had issues with them not being honest when I took my former BMW in for service as well. It’s the closest dealership to me and still an hour and a half away. It’s a shame that honesty and integrity mean nothing to them. The fact that they just pushed the cover back up and tried to pass it off as “fixed” tells a lot about the care and pride they put in to their work. This car company seems to be going down hill fast. Their car prices have gone up but their service is minimal at best. I paid a lot of money for my car AND for the service I’m not receiving.

resp.text: Our General Manager, Roger, would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (334) 557-8873. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Chanse LaShai
text:
Couple years back, brought in my vehicle and asked them to check over everything to make sure it would be good for a 1500 mile journey. They only took 30 minutes, topped my fluids, and sent me on my way with the all-clear. Went elsewhere for a second opinion and they were shocked that Gill's blatantly missed (or didn't even check) that I had some serious suspension issues as well as separating tires.

Fast forward to earlier this year. Boyfriend's new car had a clutch failure. Ordered a conversion kit online to do ourselves. After not being able to put it back together it was brought to Gill's. It turned out the company we ordered from sent us the wrong kit. Gill's said it would be a week or so. After hearing nothing, had to call and see where progress was, got some excuse about why it wasn't done yet. Okay, not a big deal but should have been kept up to date. Week after week of not being kept up to date, and hearing excuse after excuse as to why, 2 months later car is ready. Car feels great, except for a weird rumbling sensation that wasn't there before. Oh well, not sure what it is. Notice a bolt just sitting in the console that wasn't there before. Turns out they didn't even connect the steering column. Thank goodness it didn't give out and KILL US while driving down 280 for the week we couldn't figure out the rumbling/random bolt. Won't ever return, and will always warn people from here on out.

name: Edward Payne
text: World Class auto repair is a Great alternative to the dealer . They gave me the Star treatment . I recommend them to everyone who want dealer service , but not dealer repair prices . Edward Payne .

resp.text: Thank you for 5 stars. We promise to continue to give you and all our customers the "star treatment "....you deserve it.  We're glad we could repair your Mercedes by replacing the ignition.

name: Don’t Worry
text: Owner quoted me at $700 then some lady quoted me $1100 at checkout. This has happened before because I read a review about this and then it happened to me. Red flags everywhere here. Went elsewhere

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with our service, but are grateful you've brought it to our attention. We invite you to call the shop in order to speak with the owner directly. We'd be happy to address your concerns and frustrations, however I believe the confusion is that you called for an estimate and the fellow you spoke with gave you a price over the phone based on your assessment of the car, but when you brought it in, we gave you an accurate estimate of what your vehicle needed, including both parts and labor.  When you have time, please call (205) 591-7990. We hope to hear from you soon so we may work to resolve the issue. Thank you!

text: Best experience I've ever had getting my car repaired. Staff is awesome and professional.

What else is there to say when they are the best. 😁😁

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words regarding the work we did on your Mercedes.

text: Brought my 1994 BMW 325is in for a driveshaft and mount issue, and they had my bimmer fixed right up. Quick turnaround and reasonable pricing. Will probably use these guys again if I need more servicing done on my car

name: David Goodwin
text:
An amazing job with an older Mercedes 300CD!  It has essentially sat for a number years and the service and repair schedule needed to begin again.  They kept in constant contact as they uncovered areas that needed to be addressed with a full explanation and estimate of the work needed.
It was a great experience and and I'm very comfortable in recommending World Class Auto Repair.

resp.text: Good customers are like good cars...hard to find...and we both lucked up.  Thanks for the great review.

text: Excellent customer service always, great cost-savings, A+++ work!!!

name: John Markus
text: I have used World Class for several years and have been quite satisfied with the quality of the work and value received.  I trust them not to recommend more than I need and to perform any necessary repairs right the first time.  Also, the offer of a ride downtown and back makes the process very convenient.

name: Dwayne Carmichael
text: Do not take your vehicle to this place. I brought my BMW X5 there to have the water pump replaced. They replaced the water pump, but damaged other parts on my vehicle while doing the repair. I was quoted $360 labor to replace the water pump. I called to check on my vehicle later that evening, and Yvonne said that her technician was having a hard time installing the water pump and that they had to charge me an extra hour worth of labor. Who fault is that? I told them no way, so they only charged me the $360 that I was originally quoted. However they did mentioned that my car needed 2 more repairs and quoted me $563 for one and $440 for the other. The $440 repair was for a hose that was damaged while they were changing the pump. The hose cost $40 from the BMW dealership and they said it would be 4 hours of labor, which didn't sound right for a hose. I called 3 other independent shops and was quoted $130 for the same repair parts and labor. The $563 was for a hood latch and cable, the parts at dealer are $80. Yvonne also said it would be 4 hours labor. I called several independent shops and was quoted $200 for parts and labor. I guess 4 is there magic number. When I asked Yvonne to double check those quotes all of a sudden she wasn't able to find the labor rates in the system. How did she come up with those figures initially? Bottom line do not take your car to these ppl. Yvonne charges you whatever she feels like and that's not right.

resp.text: We remember you well.  You brought your car late one afternoon with a coolant leak,  and we drove you across town to take you home. You didn't mention that your hood latch was locked and would not open. We spent quite a while to opened the hood to replace the water pump that you brought for us to install, and you declined the hood repair knowing that it would not reopen once it was shut.  We actually charged less labor to install the water pump than the labor guide prescribes.  We also told you about another coolant leak that you say we caused, but we did not; you also declined that repair.  Yes, we would normally charge more because of the extra work to open your hood because of the latch and cable.  Your car came in with several problems, but none caused by us.  We did our best to accommodate you in every way and we're sorry you left dissatisfied.

name: Rico Suave
text: Dropped my car off for a radiator change. It took about a week to just get an estimate when I was told it would be looked at the following morning. When I finally got the estimate, it was on the high end, quoted a few more hours than normal. Continuously called to try to get information over the next week! Was lied to several times throughout the two weeks and one day for a radiator change! Wasn't even notified when they required another part.  On top of it, the manager/owner referred to me as a "damn Yankee". Great business savvy you moron. If you want over priced work, dishonesty, ignorant management this is the place for you. Honestly, the worst experience I've ever had at a car maintenance facility.

resp.text: Sorry, Mr. Suave, but we have no record of you ever being in our shop.  We take our reviews very seriously, but you must have us confused with another shop.

The repair and ownership team take the time to get to know you and always listen to what I think is going on with my car. Hands down I wouldn't take my car any other place in the Birmingham area for regular maintenance to more complex projects.

Most of the service I have received is on a 2005 BMW x3. They are helping me keep it rolling in good shape.

name: Lance Moore
text: I've taken my car to Brown's for about two years for various maintenance and repair work.  I've told myself several times this will be my last time because I have had to take my car back for rework several times.  The last time I visited was the case.  They were suppose to repair my windshield reservoir from a blown tire.  After getting home I noticed the hose was missing from the reservoir to the wipers and no fluids in the tank.  I called the shop and told them they didn't fix it and they said there must be a hole in it.  Clearly they didn't do any work on the reservoir or even look at it.  I took it back again and they connected the hosing and told me I needed a new pump.  I probably needed a new pump, but I felt like this should have been told to me the first time.  If you're looking for a shop that can do general maintenance work use them.  The people are generally friendly, but be willing to take your car back if the problem isn't solved the first time.

name: James McCain
text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

name: Leah Autumn
text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

name: Marshall Mims
text: Great guys to work with, great attention to detail and take pride in their work.

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

name: Tara Goode
text: Take forever to fix your car.

name: marian fischer
text: Didn't know it was that hard to get tires. I guess know the mode is find a place like above or Sam's club maybe.  Called the above yesterday,gave them car info, ordered tires, called today at 2pm to come on down for the install. In less than an hour, got all 4 installed. Very, quick friendly and efficient,  I think we found our new place for oil changes too!! Thank you, Matthew.

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

I highly recommend this place.

text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

name: Alison Gentry
text: Wish I could give no stars for the rude sales manager and all five stars to Jonathan the salesman. He should be a manager! Very friendly, understanding, and respectful. We made an offer on a truck that was only $900 less than asking price. We also wanted to know trade in value for current car. Jonathan came back and the manager said he wanted full price of sticker and lowballed $2000 less than what the trade in was worth! Did not even give a counteroffer. We thanked Jonathan and said we would keep an eye out for anything else that came up we might like. Super nice guy. As we were about to get up to leave the manager came over and started yelling at us and bashing us for the offer we made! I was shocked! He kept telling us we had no idea how much the truck was worth. The offer we made was reasonable for the truck. We told him he could not give us the numbers we wanted so we were leaving. Yet he kept yelling at us and trying to tell us we were wrong! Terrible customer service. A manager should not yell at two customers telling us we are wrong because of an offer.

name: Melanie Shelly
text:
I found the car I love 2018 Nissan Maxima. I live about an hour and a half away so I really love it!  I did all my negotiating via email and set up a test drive appointment. Very, very, easy sale for the company. My biggest disappointment is the fact that the car was filthy when I arrived and the battery terminals were severely corroded. I am convinced nobody from the service department even looked under the hood until I made them.  I wanted the terminals cleaned,  I wanted an oil change,  all fluids topped off and a cabin air filter change (Very minimal requests for a car dealership) I stated it would have to be detailed inside. The detail department worked on it but they would only be there until 12 or 12:30. So we concluded our business (paid cash) and I went to lunch without the car.  Well by the time I got back the headliner was much cleaner but it smelled terribly in the car (like stagnant mop water). Nothing else was even wiped down and unfortunately the detail department was gone. There was sticky crusted disgusting something in all the buttons so some would stick in certain positions. Literally the battery terminal was only brushed with a wire brush to knock off the corrosion. I don't think the oil was changed. When I got home the oil did not appear new. I think they put new on top of the old then they mixed together. The cabin air filter was not changed. I removed it to check because everytime I used recirculated air instead of fresh it smelled bad. It has a new one now and it no longer has an odor.

My salesman was okay, but seriously the easiest commission ever. Wish I would have at least gotten an after the sale phone call. Just to check in. Would have made me feel better about the other issues.

My complaints are only directed to the service and detail departments.

I am now looking for a truck in the $20,000 range (same as my Maxima) and I am not even looking at this company now.

text: I purchased my 2012 toyota4runner from them. It was very clean and had a great experience at the dealer. They were very friendly and gave me a great deal. The best thing is they had just about every make and models there that I was looking for. I recommend this dealer. Came back and bought a 17 Sierra. Still great experience.

name: Cameron Martin
text:
I was at SKCO Automotive today. I had been there for almost 5 hours. My salesman was actually a nice  man, so i have absolutely nothing bad to say about him.  After going through this ridiculous process of trying to prove my income for 2-3 hours and trying to be put in a car  the finance company wanted me to have. I was exhausted, over it and ready to leave. As if that wasn’t enough, someone decided to make a big deal out of nothing. My children went ahead of me and went to the door. They were holding the door for each other and then was holding it for me, waiting for me to catch up and come out. Before I got to the door they were approached by a lady. She told my children to either go out the door or go find their moma or daddy and they they were letting the air out. I was appalled!! I asked her what was the problem. I asked her name and she mumbled something and I asked her again and she told me she didn’t owe me an explanation!!  Come to find out she was the owner. The salesman walked up to me try to find out what was going on. She began to butt in, so then the gentleman walked me out the door to discuss it. it started to rain, he offered to grab an umbrella for me. We make our way into the building and the owner runs up to the salesman and tells him he is her employee and He better not walk me out the door. How pathetic and nasty can a human be over nothing!!
I’m sick of people  acting ignorant for no reason towards me. So needless to say I left all deals on the table and vowed to make it known that I would never spend a dime with a company that doesn’t value my business or dollar. So it’s above me now!!

And so far from what I hear the cars are junk! A friend of mine bought a van and the alternator went out 2 days after she purchased it.

Oh and if you plan on buying a car using your business name don’t waste your time. Apparently they don’t know how to process those sales!

name: Beverly Hodges
text: I bought a 2012 Chevy Avalanche here and I'm so impressed with how professional and friendly these guys are especially in this heat...The patience they had while I test drove the trucks is unbelievable. Thanks to Mr Vic for all your help. I just love my truck.

name: Fontello Worthy
text: I was looking for a newer car so i went to Skco automotive in Mobile, Al. When I went there I went to my niece salesman and told him what I was looking for and what I wanted and I had a trade in. Everything that I wanted it was always a problem with what the financial department would finance he kept saying. I wanted a 2011 or 2012 Toyota Avalon or a 2 door 2013 Honda accord. The salesman kept trying to put me in 2015 or 2016 vehicle and that wasn't what I wanted. The salesman was real pushy and not at all patient. I left from there with a 2016 Camry, the same one he threw in my face as the 1st car I drove even though I told him I hated those Camry. In the end he wound up giving me a car i absolutely hate. He made sure he got a good commission off of me, in spite of what I told him I like and wanted. I will take my other family members to another car lot instead of this one. So now I'm going to go to my father, God mother, God sisters, sisters, and lil brother and God daddy, who are all ministers, and plead with God to reverse this curse that was done to me and make a way out of no way to get the car I want. This is so sad and disgusting to be taken advantage of like this. Should have went next door to the dealership the carsaleman  told me not to go to and get a car i wanted .

name: Lafesacalia Sims
text: I am so happy with my black sonata I brought from this dealership. After having a bad experience at SUNCOAST AUTO (DON'T GO THERE!!!); I had to get a new car, I came here and got the car I wanted. I've had my sonata for 3 years now and I love it. My next car purchase will be from this dealership and nowhere in mobile. Jeremy, I think that's his name, was great he took care of all my needs. Everyone was so nice and they took their time and didn't force me into a car I didn't like just because I can make the payments. I like this place a lot.

name: Lezah Presley
text: For anyone shopping around for a new or used vehicle I definitely recommend SKCO Automotive. They have a brand new facility, the greatest and most respectful salesmen I've ever met. The managers there try their hardest to make sure they get you the best rates and best deal to fit your wants and needs. They have highly trained mechanics to help with any mechanical problems you might need, and the service department will make sure everything is done quickly and properly. Don't even get me started on their detail department, wow, that's the only word that comes to mind when I think of how clean and detailed my car was when I purchased it. When you come to SKCO Automotive your greeted by a wonderful team of experts whose sole purpose is to have you leave in the vehicle you wanted and happy that you chose their establishment. My family has been buying vehicles from SKCO for many years and we'll always come back. It's great to be able to come back and see the same people that continue to help you each time. Thank you everyone at SKCO.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.

name: Kelsey Keusch
text: Frank was absolutely the biggest help! We've been to several different car lots in the last month and his customer service went above and beyond! Love my new car and will definitely be back!

text:
I was prepared to purchase vehicle but when I asked if they could fix a minor dent I rcvd a bunch of B.S. They shook my hand and said “Have a nice day”

I can understand why there is such a large inventory they don’t know how to close a deal.

name: Michael Hudson
text: The only reason I gave it 1 star is the sales agent Bobby. He found me a truck i liked and tried his best to help me get it. But the guy over him I think is Tim or Tom. The first day I went he told me the truck had to go through Service inspection but it shouldn't affect the price because the price HE put on the truck gave him more than enough room for repairs. When I went back the next day the truck was going to cost a lot more than it should have. He set up the price to be 15,000 out the door at 8% interest. Now here's the kicker. My wife's car was 16,000 at 8% interest and skco wanted to charge me $30 more a month than what my wife pays. The math doesn't add up. Most the vehicles are preowned, damaged and way overpriced. Save your money and go elsewhere.

name: Amanda Unrue
text:
Buying a car wasn't bad.  But they have this policy of holding the spare keys until you pick up your paperwork.  I informed them that I was going to be moving and might not be in town to pick up the spare key.  The guy who was doing my paperwork said that he would mail it to my new address(even though that is apparently against policy).  The paperwork arrived in the mail, but the spare key never did.  I called them back to check the status of that and they are now saying that they have no record of a spare key but that I can bring the car into the dealership, pay them about $400, and they'll make a new key.  So now some random person has the spare key to my car, which I find a little sketch.
**As a side note, it is my opinion that the office manager is incredibly incompetent and rude.

name: James Wilson
text: I came into SKCO Automotive to buy a Nissan Sentra that I seen online. the salesperson, a Mr. Billy Keene, informed me of an issue with this particular car. He showed me evidence that it was in need of service, however minor, before it could be sold. He actually took the car to the service department and fussed at the service manager telling him that, "I have a man here to buy this car and you all could have had this ready a week ago." Billy persisted until the service department took care of the issue. He and I sat while they took care of the issue and I found him to be very astute about all sorts of subjects regarding cars and how financing works. He took time with me he did not have to take. He also made it possible that the car that i wanted was serviced before I left in it a few hours later. I cant say enough about this salesman, and also about the sales manager, a Mr. Joe. The Dealership as a whole was easy to deal with and Billy and Joe were actually able to get me out the door $500 less than the advertised price. If you need a good quality vehicle, i highly recomend SKCO, and really recomend dealing with Billy.

text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR TO THESE GUYS. THEY ARE A TOTAL RIP OFF! THEY CHARGE MORE THAN THE DEALERSHIP WOULD CHARGE YOU. DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE YOU LET THESE GUYS RIP YOU OFF!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!! UPDATE: THE REASON WHY SOME COMPANIES GIVE SUCH LONG WARRANTIES IS BECAUSE THEIR PRODUCT IS USUALLY JUNK AND THEY ARE JUST SELLING YOU ON THE WARRANTY, NOT THE PRODUCT.

resp.text: I hate that we couldn’t find mutual ground on fixing the car you inquired about but I feel that I properly explained that the engine we were pricing is Remanufactured and has a 3 year warranty and it wasn’t priced from Jasper but would be similar quality. This is the closest option to a “new” engine for a car that is 14 years old. LKQ offers only a 6 month warranty and sells used engines . Saying that a Remanufactured engine such as the one we priced is the same as a used engine that LKQ offers is simply false . If it were true, the warranties would be the same .

name: Jordon May
text: I highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange! Jordan was awesome and went above and beyond for us. We were at another dealership and called to see what he could do for us. He got us a better deal on a better car, so we drove 2 and a half hours to get it! !We will go there from now on to buy!

resp.text: Ryan thank you for the 5 stars and the kind comments.  We strive to do the best job we can and treat our customers the way we would want to be treated.

name: Brent Vance
text:
Worked with Mitch here and was not disappointed. He didn’t BS me or tried to conceal any information.

He also let me come after hours to see a car and then stayed an additional 3 hours after closing to work finance terms on my 2013 Elantra.

The car is very clean and they put a lot of miscellaneous service work that I requested before I picked it up a couple days later.

I highly recommend this business.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Vance! Dont forget to come back for your free Oil Change!

name: Len Gordon
text: My wife and I purchased a used Tahoe from them. We dealt with Jordan during the purchase. I have purchased several used vehicles that items were given a "Band Aid" to hide problems and that did not occur here. Overall I feel they were honest and did not try to hide anything from us. I came with a change of clothes and gloves to go through the vehicle myself, instead they let me go through the car on one of their racks. The vehicle checked out as we had discussed. Also, I might add that I feel like Jordan really put in the extra effort to ensure he earned our business. The paperwork and transaction was simple and very straight forward.

resp.text:
Thank you guys, it was a pleasure to meet you.  We look forward
to helping you and your friends in the future.  Dale Moates

name: David Giles
text: Bought a gorgeous low mileage Miata from Jordan and crew.  They were very friendly and honest and the vehicle was just as described except for one minor issue.  I had been told it had a new battery, but during inspection we discovered that the battery was not new. It was just a mix-up and they were happy to install a new battery while we were finishing up the financial side of the deal.  Would have loved to have gotten the car at a bit lower price (who wouldn't?) but this was an exceptional low-mileage one-owner specimen, and they did work with me on the price.  I've shopped Miatas for quite some time and lately Carvana seems to have almost cornered the market on clean low-mileage Miatas and have jacked the prices up really high.  But I was able to buy this Miata well below what Carvana would have priced it at, and I feel that I got a good deal considering the current market and the premium condition of this vehicle  (and lots of buyers have had very bad experiences with Carvana, so I'm glad I didn't have to deal with them).  Highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange and would absolutely do business with them again!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Giles for the review.  We appreciate your kind words, yes Carvana is not what everyone thinks it is, I've heard nothing but horror stories and that "return policy" is quite the scam.  Enjoy that beautiful Miata.

name: AJ Nashville
text: Ive had incredible luck with Moates. As an out of state buyer you typically run into questions that most local buyers dont have. Simply because you cannot see the car first hand. Ive always ran into an issue that when I showed up at other places to pick up my nice new car, its never what I expected it to be. Thats not the case with Moates. The staff there has been extremely forth coming and honest when it comes to small things like dings and scratches on a car. This way when I arrive, I know what to expect. My next car will come from here, its a drive but its one that I see as well worth the time. Thanks Moates for an awesome car buying experience!

name: S. Berlet
text: We bought a great car at a great price from an awesome sales person! Thank you Jordan McDonald for an incredible and quick car buying experience.

resp.text: Glad we could help you get a great vehicle at a great price! Thanks for letting us know how everything went for you, and we're always here to help if you need anything else. -Dale M., Business Owner

name: Rev. Clayton Lassiter
text: I bought my wife her 2018 Sonata and got a great deal from Dale and the team. I would and probably will buy again and I live 3 hours away now!

resp.text: Satsuma, I'm so glad I was able to help you and your wife find the perfect car! Whenever we can help, don't hesitate to stop by or give us a call. -Dale M., Business Owner

name: Jodi Berger
text: How dare you assume that we are ungrateful. My husband gave them more than half for the vehicle. It was NOT at no cost. This is not about the church, who helped us tremendously during hard times. That was pretty low of you. You sold the vehicle "as is," I understood what that meant. My husband was warned "do not drive it very far." After a week, a main component (the fly wheel and belt), literally fell out of the vehicle while I was driving. I lost all power. I and/or my husband or someone else could have been fatally injured. The reason for what happened was that it was improperly torqued. We would have been back to not having a vehicle. Only the parts that you replaced were new, everything else had to be replaced from factory parts. Hadn't you even done a tune up? The filters were all factory. Like I said, "as is," but it should have been thoroughly inspected by a mechanic. Most likely, you only did what was necessary to pass the inspection. Do not assume that because I'm female that I don't know anything about cars. I do, I was the owner of a NASCAR in the '80s and raced with the legends. You wanted an edit, this is what happened and your response was shameful.

resp.text:
As clearly stated on the CARFAX history service records. 7/3/18  Control Arms, Ball Joints, and Sway Bar links and alignment. All Parts replaced were new OEM quality, I have the receipts.  Repair order #19147  anyone disputing that is misleading you, btw.

This work was done prior to your "acquisition."

I say "acquisition" because you DID NOT buy / purchase ANYTHING. This old (but clean) 1996 SUV was as a GIFT to you at NO COST by a charitable group of church members to help you, to give you a way to go.  You paid for NOTHING for that vehicle (which given to you) well over a year ago.
If you "could have BOUGHT a brand new car" why did you need others to pool their money to GIVE you an SUV?

Rethink who you call "Swindlers" next time you decide to get mad because your 23 year old vehicle might need some maintenance.

I'll give you the opportunity to edit your review and apologize for your comments and misleading review.  Only actual customers leave reviews and comments per Google's Policy and you have never spent $1 here.  You are NOT a customer and obviously you are NOT thankful either.

P.S.  If anyone who works with charitable organizations and give their time and money to help others, please do not let "this example" deter you from your heart's desires and work.  Most people are very thankful.

text: I love getting my car fixed at Moates! They are excellent! I just love Bryan, Wayne, and Calvin Cole! They are hilarious and everytime I go they give me a wonderful experience. They fix my car right on up. Their customer service is amazing. If I could I would give them 100 stars!!!!

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

Amazing customer service!  A+!  I will be using them for the service of my car.

name: jeffrey vaughn
text: I grew up next door to Jeff. I remember a day when I looked out and saw a 2nd gen camaro with a blower sitting a foot out of the hood. It was Jeff. I was a kid and did the burnout hand signal..to which he happily obliged. Worked with his lil sis many years later and he still remembered. Genuinely thoughtful and kind dude who exudes knowledge.

name: Bailey Ike
text: The customer service is outstanding, the people working there feel authentic and give the impression they truly care.

name: Radioman
text:
Jeff @ HESCO is unparalleled in his infinite wisdom behind the wheel and under the hood of a car. He has been known to pull a rabbit out of a hat on many occasions. I would not hesitate to take any of my vehicles to him for any reason.
Thanks, Jeff-
Tim @ Rickwood Radio Service

name: Eric Morin
text: At last found a shop to work on my Mazda RX-8 R3 with a twin rotary. Honest diagnosis and job well done. Think it runs better than when I bought it! Thank you Jeff and crew!

resp.text: Thank you for the outstanding feedback, Eric! We are so glad that you were able to find a shop that fit your auto needs, we look forward to working with you and your RX-8 again!

name: Charles B Ireland
text: I have been taking my machine work to Hesco for many years. Best machine shop anywhere. Now that I no longer work on my own vehicles, I intend to entrust them with their care.

resp.text: Charles, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. It is a pleasure to work see you in our machine shop. We are so glad we have gained your long term trust! Let us know if there is anything we can assist you with!

name: Nichole Posten
text: As someone indicated, they do a lot of specialty high end vehicle work but it has been well worth the extra to know that the work is done right.  I have been taking my now 10yr old (beater) Jeep here for 8+ years and will take my new Subaru here.  Joe is great and always has the time to spend explaining anything to you.  He even took my husband and son around the shops to look at all of the cars there.

resp.text: Thank you for your loyalty over the years Nichole, we truly appreciate it!

name: Stephen Wilson
text: These guys do some of the best work in Birmingham. That being said, when you see the Ferraris and classic cars in the parking lot you know you are going to pay a price that matches their level of quality work. Don't let the abrasive or lack of communication keep you from at least getting a written quote from their shop. On a side note, get someone to show you around their facility because it is basically an ever changing museum of mechanical genius. Custom builds, daily drivers, etc it's a pretty cool spot in the heart of downtown. If all else fails, you can walk to Good People Brewery or Regions Park  and drink away your sorrows.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review, Stephen! We appreciate getting your feedback and we hope next time we can deliver a 5-star experience!

name: Lindsay Hobbs
text:
I have nothing but good things to say about Hesco and the people working there! My husband and I were driving from Utah to Atlanta when our car broke down in Birmingham. Even though they were busy, they fit us in and got us back on the road the next day! Not only did they fix our car, but they went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of while we were stuck in the city. They even called us a few days later to make sure we had made it to our destination safely and without any problems!
We are SO grateful for Jeff, Joe, and everyone else who took such good care of us! This was by far the best experience we have ever had with a mechanic, and would recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Lindsay! We are glad you arrived safely, and we can't thank you enough for all the kind words. Our goal is to provide our customers with an unbeatable experience every time!

name: Prentice Jones
text: One of my best friends works at this shop so I know they are an A+ shop because Warren is a very good tech.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! We are so glad to have Warren on our team! We appreciate the great recommendation!

name: Jacob Hobbs
text: These are the kind of guys that would take their shirts off their backs to help you. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates honest and high quality work!

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Jacob. That is exactly who we strive to be. Thank you for your business, and we hope to see you again!

name: James Gavin
text: On a recent trip from Birmingham back to Atlanta my 2012 Hyundai Equus ran hot about 30 miles outside of Birmingham, we got off at exit 147 wound up having to get it towed back to Birmingham. I didn't know a mechanic in B'ham so I had it delivered to J.B. a Buick dealership, they inspected it for $309 and said that I at the least had a blown head gasket caused by a bad water pump and that it was going to cost me $2215  for them to break down the engine and make sure that there was no further damage with the engine,  and that it could be as much as $4500 to replace all the gaskets through out the engine. NOT TODAY!!! So I did a Google search and came across HESCO, the reviews were great, I spoke with Joe Molina and he arranged to have it tower to HESCO "DESPITE being in the middle of changing locations", they got it in checked it out, started it up, "No white smoke from the tail pipe", turned out to be the water pump, THAT's ALL. I can't recommend Joe Molina and the guys at HESCO Automotive highly enough, they are highly professional, extremely efficient, keep you informed at every juncture of the process, and very reasonable. I am telling ALL my friends and family to take their vehicles to HESCO Automotive. Thanks guys, this was a very stressful situation as I was having to take care of it from Atlanta, Joe you could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you James! It is great to hear from you and glad we could help you out.  We want to make sure all of our costumes are taken care of and are aware of the repairs needed for their vehicle. We are glad you found us and we could located the problem to your water pump. We truly appreciate your recommendation. Give us a call if you have questions or need anything in the future!

name: Ron Denney
text: I had a bolt sheared off inside my BMW motorcycle wheel. I called Wesco from Hoover and explained the situation and that I lived 90 miles south in Dadeville, AL. I spoke with Joe on the phone. He said bring it in and they would see what they could do for me. They used an easy out to remove the bolt for me quickly and wouldn't even take any money for this service. Great people at WESCO!

resp.text: We really appreciate the excellent review, Ron. We are happy to help. Let us know if there is anything else we can help you with!

name: Ray Clark
text: I have a Z-3 and a 535i and would not let anyone else touch them in Birmingham.  I used to go to Tom Williams for items under warranty and they always found something to fix that did not need fixing.  Anything Joe, Jeff and his folks say, I trust completely.

resp.text: Ray - We cannot thank you enough for your business and the great review! We appreciate being able to work with you.

name: Dawn Brook
text: I took my wife's 07 Murano in for a few repairs and got the same great service as all the exotics Hesco works on. Great guys and service.

resp.text: Roy - Thank you for the great review! It is always a pleasure to be able to work with you and we cannot thank you enough for your business.

name: Katie munkus
text: I was very disappointed with this business. I had to have my car towed here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. I was told that I would get a detailed estimate the following Monday. I was fine with that. When I called Monday I was told that they had already started replacing and fixing the damaged parts to my car without my permission and without my knowledge. So I specifically said please stop working on it until I get the detailed estimate I was promised and had looked it over. The next day I decided to have my car towed to a different shop that specializes in Volkswagen and Audi cars. When I called Hesco to tell them what I had decided they informed me that my car was almost completely finished. The owner made a decision without my permission yet again and without calling to inform me what was going on. I was highly disappointed that every decision made about my car was made without my input or knowledge. And that my request for them to stop the repairs was completely ignored. This business is very unprofessional and lacks the ability to communicate with their customers. I also feel that I was taken advantage of because I am a woman. Not to mention the repairs done to my car were done wrong. I ended up having to have all the transmission fluid drained and replaced bc they used a brand that is not recommended for German cars. I also had to have the tires rebalanced and aligned bc Hesco didn't properly do that either. I do not recommend this business to anyone.

name: Douglas Smith
text: Apparently Jim Burke Subaru won't work on modified Subaru's (so basically every WRX)... Hesco came through and even purchased the updated software so that they could diagnose my car. Skip Jim Burke and take your modified Subie here.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback Douglas, we are glad we were able to help when others fell short.

name: T Adams
text: These guys are truly great!

resp.text: Thank you, Rai for the 5-stars and kind words! We greatly appreciate it.

name: John Waldo
text: Don't take your Eaton supercharged vehicle here.

name: André Garcia
text:
It's ok for the price.  However the reason they don't get the extra 3 stars is because they are always trying to sell you stuff you don't need, which is why I stooped coming back to this place before. Decided to give it a try and it was the same think.

The service guy called me in the garage to show me "something on my car".  He had the air filter open and he pointed to it and pointed to my EXHAUST MANIFOLD and told me that my injectors and inside "there" was full of  "gunk" and that I needed a fuel injector cleaning for $59.   FIRST, the fuel injectors are NOT inside the EXHAUST MANIFOLD or the air filter.  Second, unless you took apart my valve cover you HAVE NO IDEA how clean/dirty my injectors are.  My car is fairly new which quite low mileage and very well maintained,  don't try to scam me into something that I DON'T need,  or even if I did you wouldn't know simply by pointing to my Exhaust Manifold.

There is a good reason the place across the street "Firestone" was packed with people and they are more expansive and this place was empty.  It's called HONESTY.

resp.text:
Dear André,
We are sorry your last visit to our auto shop did not meet your expectations. Our staff is well trained to identify maintenance issues on each vehicle we diagnose. We are a family owned honest, friendly, and affordable auto maintenance shop. We'd greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss your concerns further, in hopes of reaching a positive resolution. Please contact one of the owners at your earliest convenience, in hopes of making this right with you. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham
(205) 637-5523

name: Jade Howlet
text: I never had an experience so BAD! I get my tires rotated and oil changed. I come back to get the same services done. The mechanic tells me whoever rotated my tires last stripped my lug nut post. When they realize they were the ones who did it they tell me I need to sign a waiver for them to try to fix it or pay for a whole new post! I will never be back!

resp.text:
Dear Jade,
We really appreciate our customers and continuously strive to provide excellent customer service. Our records do not show you as a client of ours. Is there a possibility the transaction is under a different name? We are happy to discuss any issues you might have with your vehicle and try to reach a reasonable solution.
Please give us a call at (205) 637-5523 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Trent Daniels
text: Front desk lady was very nice. The gentleman working on my truck was very informative. I always come here for an oil change, doesnt take long at all. You cant beat these prices

resp.text:
Dear Trent,
We wanted to say a big "thanks" for your nice review. We will certainly pass along the compliments to our staff. We enjoy taking great care of our customers by delivering affordable pricing and efficient services. Customers like you make our jobs rewarding and enjoyable. Thank you!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Justin McClew
text: Nice people that don't do nice work. Took it for the premium oil change. Told me all the belts and hoses looked good, air filter was good everything is topped off, but my radiator was leaking. Soon as I left there was a big vibration in it... Let the car sit for 3days, both radiator hoses needed to be replaced, leaking because of corrosion, the air filter was horrible, the pcv valve was clogged, power steering that doesn't leak was empty and the vibration was because they put 2 quarts more oil than the engine was supposed to have!! Quoted me a price to get a radiator when it was a hose they told me was good!

name: monica mitchell
text: I am sitting here now for the third time since a tune up and oil change last week. As soon as I drive off I noticed my car was missing in a cylinder. Had to come back and get a coil replaced immediately. Also my power steering fluid was extremely low and my coolant level was low. once again drove off and noticed oil burning. I couldn't come right back but came back a few days later and it was the plug gasket. So either it wasn't checked when the oil was drained or the tightest plug too tight. Once again even left after gasket replace and car is still burning oil. Now it smokes too. Telling me it's the axle boot which is messed up but none of this began until immediately after I've left from getting service done here. I'm so disappointed because the last time I was here I had such a good experience I thought I had found my new spot to get work done on my car.

resp.text:
Dear Monica,
We are very sorry you are experiencing auto issues. We have checked our records and our auto center does not show the name used on the review as a customer at our auto shop. We would like to assist you in finding a positive resolution and ask that you give one of us a call at the number shown below. We are happy to talk with you at your earliest convenience. Thanks so much!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

(205) 637-5523

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: I drive all the way from Southside to bring my car here. They are faster than that express place, at half the price but with better service.  The last time I was there, the tech noticed how terrible my headlights were and let me know they were running a special to fix them for just $20. Now I don't have to drive with my brights on!

name: Mrs. Williams
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!! I REPEAT!! SAVE YOUR CAR AND MONEY AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! My husband took his Classic Car here for an detailed  job , after picking up the vehicle the following Monday it would not crank. Upon returning my husband was told that they will not be able to work on his car after receiving the money to fix the issue.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Williams,
We are saddened to read this review. Our staff has tried to work with your husband and his classic car in a patient, honest, and friendly manner. We feel like we have done everything we could to assist you and wish you all the best.
~Jamie and Rick Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jeremy Hinton
text: They corrected several issues that left my car unsafe. They were fast, courteous and did a great job. I'll be recommending them to friends!

resp.text:
Dear Jeremy,
Thanks so much for posting the 5-star review of our auto services. It is so nice to read that you received fast and courteous auto repair services during your recent visit to our shop. The recommendations are greatly appreciated and we look forward to seeing you again. All the best!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Drew Cottrell
text: Ive heard this location has been shut down but ive been here recently, great service

resp.text:
Hello Drew,
Your patronage at our auto center is greatly appreciated. Thanks for the compliment on our auto services.

You are correct, we have closed this location and plan to relocate about 25 miles away close to Finley Avenue and Farmers Market. We also have a Precision Tune Auto Care center in Alabaster, which is only 6 miles away from our old Pelham shop.

We hope to see you again so we can continue providing you with excellent auto maintenance services. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: D F
text: They test the cars they service by flying up and down hilltop business dr as fast as they can.

resp.text:
Dear Drew,
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We too have noticed that there seems to be a lot of vehicles driving faster than they should on Hilltop Drive. Please know that we have addressed this concern with  our employees and have emphasized how important it is to follow the speed limit at all times. Safety is our number one concern in our shop, and also as we test drive any vehicles. If you have any additional questions, or concerns, please feel free to call the store manager, Kevin Gainey, at (205) 637-5523. Thank you very much!

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: I WAS a long time client until this weekend when they over charged us (found out too late after spending over $650!!) & my husband gave them instructions to leave our car locked outside of their shop, for us to pick up, since we couldn't come until after they were closed. Not only was our car not outside for us, it was still on the rack with the hood up in the shop!! We had to back track to our house & my husband was late for his job! We are VERY disappointed. We have literally spent thousands there through the years. And we are done.

name: Jennifer Cargile
text:
My husband went in with his CRV on a Saturday about 9am for a normal oil change and a check engine light, was told that he needed some spark plugs and new oil pan gasket (there were NO oil leaks that we had noticed, and we were told it was loosing 80% of its oil) and was told it wouldn't take long at all, maybe an hour,  well he didn't leave until after 12 (receipt said 1217). He asked multiple times if it was ready, was told only 20 more mins, then 30...well 2 hours after the said time he left. We had plans at 11am, so those didn't happen WHICH could have been planned for-like loading up my kids (one being a newborn) in the car and picking him up. No apologies for the extra wait time and never honest about how long it was going to take.
Come that following week, SURPRISE, there was an oil leak on the garage floor AND the check engine light was back on. So we took it back once again. He was told that it was just old oil coming out and it was fine and that some other piece needed to be replaced for the check engine light. Like why wasn't this fixed the first time!? Unless we got super unlucky and something went wrong within the 3/4 day time.

Well now it's about 4 months later and there's still oil spots on the floor!
So we called today, I got a so-so person on the phone and was told to bring it back in, no "oh my goodness! That's not what we like to hear..please bring it back in!" It was just "bring it back".

1st, can we make the comparison on the comment from Ashton Morgan below?? This was the SAME day, the SAME time and my husband remembers talking and waiting with Ashton.
We aren't very knowledgable on car repairs and we should've gotten a 2nd opinion(the Garage in Pelham is literally walking distance and everyone always has great things to say about them, but this was just for a cheap oil change-never again!) ..but we just had a baby and didn't have much spare time or sleep to decide these things with a clear mind.

I just reccomend going somewhere else for piece of mind EVEN for an oil change, even if this was just a random bad day (which look at the rating-use your brains people! We didn't and now we're paying for it with our time and now a nasty driveway and garage floor) for the people working on cars, there has yet to be a verbal apology-and now if we get one it will just seem forced.

resp.text:
Dear Jennifer,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham. We wanted to apologize for the long wait during your last visit with us. We know our customers time is valuable and we always strive to provide a reasonable time estimate on each service we perform. I can assure you we addressed the waiting issue and are thrilled to have a new store manager.

Our records show we serviced your vehicle in early February 2016. We offer a 12-month warranty on all services and encourage you to contact us at (205) 637-5523 to set up a follow-up appointment. Since your vehicle has over 189,000 miles on it, there may be another leak requiring some attention. We look forward to making this right with you. Thank you!

name: Michelle Thompson
text: Quick oil change! Very nice staff!!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our auto shop for your recent oil change, Ms. Thompson. We love our customers and appreciate your business very much. We look forward to seeing you again for any of your other car care needs.  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jarrard Blanco
text: Very prompt service and a knowledgeable, courteous staff.

resp.text:
Dear Jarrard,
It is great to read that our staff was able to provide you with prompt and knowledgeable auto repair services, topped off with great customer service. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you for your business!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Michael Johnson
text: My wife took her SUV here last week for oil change and now I have oil puddles all over my driveway!!!!!

resp.text:
Dear Michael,

We apologize for your mishap regarding your recent visit to Precision Tune Auto Care, Hilltop.  It is our goal to make sure each person has a positive experience with us.  It's customers like you that help us to make adjustments in our shops, to better serve you and other customers.  This has been pointed out to the employees so this doesn't happen again.  We are sorry for what happened and we thank you for your feedback.

Sincerely,
Rick Martin
205-637-5523

name: Osman Miranda
text: Is a pretty nice place!!

name: Christine Norris
text: So friendly and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you very much for the 5-star review of our auto center, Christine! Your business is appreciated and we are always glad to provide you with friendly and helpful auto services. All the best to you!  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: juan pardo
text: Great work and fast!

name: Rachel McGuff
text: Quick and affordable.

resp.text:
Dear Rachel,
We are so happy to read that your recent visit to our auto shop provided you with quick and affordable services. We love happy customers and wanted to thank you for your business. Cheers!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Lindsey R Swinford
text: Great service!

resp.text:
Dear Lindsey,
Thanks so much for your kind review of our auto services. We appreciate you taking the time to post it for our shop!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Zac Martin
text: Great service

resp.text: Thanks so much, Zac, for this 5-star rating of our auto shop. We appreciate your business very much. ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Mike Menendez
text: nice people

name: Candy Marbrey
text: EXCELLENT

resp.text: Ms. Marbrey - Thank you for visiting our auto shop for your recent maintenance. It was our pleasure to provide you with excellent customer service. ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Taylor Wright
text: Matt or whatever his name is, is slow he’s the manager of the whole place and he has had my car for over 3 WEEKS and nothing has been done to it he has told me that it’ll be done on this day, that day comes and the car is still not ready. The lady that answers the phone is very nonchalant, the workers are rude, there isn’t any type of greeting when you get to this place, this place is a 0/10 never bring your car here unless you have another at home you can drive until yours get fixed and i’m paying these people almost 2 thousand dollars on something they haven’t even started on yet.

resp.text: Hello Taylor, my name is Linda I am one of the owners at Mr T's. I would like to speak to you concerning your experience but I can't find any information in your name. May I ask if your vehicle is your name or some one else's ? What make and model is it and what repair did we do? Without any information I can't address your issue. Can I ask that you please call me personally at 205-786-8279? I want you to know I am very sorry about this and  interested in listening to what happened directly from you. Please call me.

name: Larry Robbins
text: Great service department. Friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Larry! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed working with our team during your time in our shop. We hope that you will consider choosing Mr. T's Automotive when your vehicle is in need of repair or maintenance in the future!

name: Cherrie Cooper
text: I love Mr. T'S they are reasonable and respectful and good at what they do on your car, thanks again Mr. T's for working on my car for the second time,  I wouldn't take it any place else but you guys.

resp.text: Thank you, Cherrie, for the 5-stars and for taking the time to leave us a review. We appreciate your kind words, and for making Mr. T's Automotive your go-to automotive repair shop!

name: Johnathan Harris
text: This was a warranty through car dealership visit they fixed everything that the dealership seemed to miss before they sold me the car. If I have anymore problems in the future im always coming to Mr.Ts from now on they treat you like family

resp.text: Thank you Johnathan! Please do not hesitate to give us a call if you need anything else!

name: Eric Mcghee
text: Mr T'S Automotive Does Excellent Work And They Have Your Vehicle Serviced And Ready in A Timely Manor And They Stand Behind Their Work !! I would Recommend My Family And Friend's !!

resp.text: Thank you Eric for the 5-stars and awesome review! We appreciate you sharing the word about Mr. T's Automotive to your friends and family!

name: Raymond Harkins
text: Great service and knowledge of 🚘

resp.text: Thank you Raymond! We appreciate your review and will always work on your vehicle with our full knowledge and effort! Take care.

name: Jonathan Teesdale
text: I usually don't write reviews but Mr T got me out of a bind when my boat trailer came loose off 59. The axle was bent and I slowly crawled off the exit to his shop. He took the time to go out of his way and fix the trailer that same day. The price was very fair and the quality of work was excellent. They are good people and I would recommend his shop to anyone. Thank you, Mr T!

resp.text: Thank you, Jonathan for taking the time to leave us a review! We're always happy to help a lending hand to customers in need, as we know how scary and frustrating a situation like that can be. Thank you again for your kind words, and for visiting Mr. T's Automotive!

name: Sharlene Brown
text: Received car back with missing parts, drove car home and parked it.  Two days later drove it and it broke down while driving it after I paid $1700.00 for it to be repaired. Was told it was the engine why wasn't that found when the $1700.00 work was done?????

resp.text: Thank you Sharlene for taking the time to leave us your feedback! On April 4th we put a rack and pinion steering sector and a power steering pump on your car. Your timing chain broke, there is no way to predict that the timing chain is going to break. It is always a good idea to replace it when recommended by the manufacturer so that it doesn't break and destroy the motor.

name: Pam Steele
text: I am at Mr T’s shop with my daughter and the manner of communication given to my daughter by an employee was unprofessional i.e. talking about her hair and children; stating that he understands why her hair is “glued on” since she has so many children. when we returned immediately after picking up her car because of engine light being on he stated well you might as well get it fixed too since you have your income tax money......very rude and appears to have an set opinion of certain people. Know this; all people of color are not ignorant to employee’s or employers who  apparently  do not have their facts or business etiquette in order. We are waiting outside over an hour for wiring to sensor to correct check engine light. I have had to cancel my business appointments today by the way is how we paid for this fiasco. Such a bad way to earn business from customers however they choose to pay

resp.text: Ms Grant, I am very sorry that you were offended that certainly was not my intention. Let me first say that I am not a racist person, my business would not have survived 30 plus years in a predominately black community if I was. I try to treat my customers like family or at  least like a close friend without the thought that some people may take offense to it. I often come into the lobby and interact with my customers, mostly to let them know they are more to me than just a dollar. I believe that most appreciate that or I wouldn't have been here as long as I have. My business is built on word of mouth from family member to family member, friends to friends then coworkers and others. I know the majority of my customers by name, I know their spouses, mothers and fathers, sisters and brothers and their children. Again, I apologize for offending you and I truly hope that I have not lost your daughters business through this misunderstanding.

name: christopher mennefield
text: Best mechanic in the south

resp.text: That means the world to us, Christopher! Thank you again for the 5-stars and for making Mr. T's Automotive your go-to automotive repair shop! We'll see you next time!

name: Anterrio Perry
text: Took my lancer in, and they really did a great job on my exhaust system. Sound's awesome

resp.text: Thank you Anterrio for the 5-stars and wonderful feedback! Thank you for choosing Mr. T's Automotive for your exhaust work on your Lancer! We'll see you again the next time you need us!

name: Ricardo Mullin
text: Everything was done very professionally and very timely.

resp.text: Thanks Ricardo! We appreciate your feedback!

name: Richard Martin
text: A quality mechanic shop

resp.text: Thank you Richard! We appreciate you visting Mr. T's Automotive!

name: Brenda Jackson
text: WOW!!! I must tell about my wonderful experience with this place. I was greeted with a smile. The young lady was very polite and listened to my concerns, and got my car looked at by the owner quickly. I explained to her that I was having back surgery the next day and would bring my car by to get the needed repairs. The young lady , Stephanie typed me an estimate with needed repairs and the amounts of them so I could give my husband. She called me to let me know my car was ready and then helped me and my husband make payment (he was in another state at this time). The process was so smooth she was so helpful and concerned. To top it off when I came to pick up my car, I was greeted by that wonderful smile again and she pulled my car to the front and helped me in. Thank You, Thank You Stephanie and Mr. Ts, I have never received this multitude of service from a repair shop! Best experience ever, I will be back and sending you more business!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5-star review Ms. Jackson, and for your business. Also, thank you for recognizing one of our employees! We will let Stephanie know what a great job she's doing.

name: Antonio Gulley
text: I have a 2008 white Dodge Charger MR T’s put a motor in my car and a  Coolant reservoir total $4100.00 he told me the new motor they put in my car had 18  Thousand miles  wow that’s a new.the car was driving nice and  smooth.but after two weeks of driving  my check engine light came on and the car start shaking real bad and    Running rough. I never had a car with 18 thousand miles on it running rough or all the cars I rented with 18 thousand miles on it running rough like this. So I called him and told him what the problem was and they told me to bring it up there So I drop the car off Wednesday late evening by the way I stayed about 12 miles away but when I was driving to the shop it wasn’t running rough anymore. He called me Friday morning he told me they drove and drove the car and he said they couldn’t find anything wrong with it so I picked the car it and drove the car about 8 miles to the store and came back out  The car is shaking and running rough again and it is barely pulling a little hill.  So I called him and told him what was going on with the car again he told me to bring it back up there again Monday ..  they are very nice he is not give me any problems about bringing my car back up there but I just want my car fixed  so I will keep you guys posted with this review after I pick my car up after Monday  to be continued...

name: Doyle Bright
text:
Mr T's automotive strives to satisfy the customer Matt Tortorici is very knowledgeable he has been working with cars and building engines from back in the mid 70's .  I had a coolant leakage problem with my GMC 1500 Sierria 5.3 liter Truck.  GM used defective castech heads casting#706 from 2002 thru 2007 they were made in China. The heads will crack at the head bolts causing coolant to leak into engine. GM would not fix the Issue and had multiple other shops in the Birmingham area try and repair the same old casting 706 and it would last for around 60k miles and crack again.  We put casting 243 heads on my 2002 5.3 liter
and so far so good it seems to have lost little low end but picked up some upper end power. Matt went over everything with me and even steamed cleaned my engine also repaired my AC.  I highly recommend Mr T's / Matt Tortorici he didi exceleent job on my Truck.. MShelto

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great feedback. We do appreciate our customers and we realize how big trust is in the auto repair industry. We're so glad we've earned yours Doyle! Thanks again for the review!

text: VERY POOR SERVICE. I Would never go back nor recommend this business to anyone. My husband dropped his vehicle off. (Drove it in) After waiting 3 long, ridiculous months for the repairs to be finished, and spending 3,000 dollars, the vehicle was not in drivable condition and had to be towed away. The vehicle is in worst condition after receiving repairs from Mr. T's. You're very eager to provide a speedy response to a public review, but if you were as eager to provide excellent customer service you wouldn't have so many negative reviews to respond to. Provide this same eagerness, and willingness to provide clarification when a customer is standing before you, with questions about their invoice or inquiries about such lengthy auto repair times. This review is not worthy of your response as I've already heard all of your excuses and even read some of them in your responses to reviews. My Mechanic is on vacation, waiting for parts to arrive, dealing with a warranty issue etc. However none of this explains why it took 3 months to render repairs, why were there services on my invoice that had not been performed on my vehicle and why my vehicle is not in drivable condition today. When this issue was presented to the business owner instead of him treating a paying consumer with respect, I was met with, anger, frustration, he himself had a lack of understanding, unwillingness to explain, lack of empathy. He was truly unconcerned and appeared as if he didn't care. No need for your public, heartfelt, speedy response.

resp.text:
Do you know the legal liability you have imposed on yourself by posting a malicious business review with a fake Google account? You should look it up. With that said here is our reply to your review.
I am sorry you are having an issue after the repair but an engine replacement is just that, the engine along with any extra parts that we felt were questionable and they are listed on your invoice. There is not an ECM on your invoice. Please keep in mind that there are several other things under the hood of your car that can also cause future problems. Unfortunately we are not able to detect a component such as an ECM, starter, alternator, Oxygen Sensor, Injector and so on that is about to go bad, it is just impossible. Your vehicle is 11 years old and does have 175,000 miles on and usually parts and components will begin to fail and need replacing after 10 years. This ECM is not covered under warranty because we did not replace this part and it does not come with an engine. I have copied and pasted some information for you that came from a site called my mechanic explaining the ECM’s function to your car. We have ordered the ECM, as you know, and as soon as it is installed and the car is test drove we will call you.
Here is some information that I pulled from the site "My Mechanic" that may help you better understand an ECM's function.
The engine control module (ECM), also commonly referred to as the engine control unit (ECU) or powertrain control module (PCM), is one of the most important components found on virtually all  vehicles. It essentially functions as the main computer for many of the vehicle’s engine performance and drivability functions. The ECM takes the information from the engine's various sensors and uses that information to calculate and tune engine spark and fuel for maximum power and efficiency. Erratic engine behavior also indicates a bad or failing ECM. A faulty computer may cause the vehicle to intermittently stall or misfire. The symptoms might come and go and not appear to have any sort of pattern to their frequency or severity. The ECM plays a vital role in engine performance. Any issues with it can cause major problems with the overall functionality of the car.
