name: Soul Jah
text:
WARNING! WARNING! ...Avoid at all cost!! This business is not what they claim they are. My P30 Step Van was towed in to get a refreshing and almost had to be towed away. I heard their ad on the radio, gave them a call and found out they service Cintas vans. I spoke to the owner Matt on the phone and he assured me that he was the place to come to and he would take care of me. I told him what I wanted done, I also left a list with the most important to be taken care of first (fuel tank leak and master cylinder replacement) with the receptionist. I mentioned new tires but didn’t decide what to install, but he did, and installed them without my consent. Later he said he thought that’s what I wanted “the cheap ones.” He decided to do what he wanted and void my concerns (that I spoke of on every visit). I was charged over $400.00 in parts (radiator, v belt and lug nuts) plus labor @ $74/hour added without my consent nor were they spoken of when I made payments in person. I was charged ($35.00) for an air cleaner that he had left from a previous vehicle and promised that he wouldn’t charge me for since I was getting so much work done. That Monday of week three, I stopped by to realize no work had been done over the past 5 days and I immediately stopped the work and told them I would be back in the morning to pick up and pay off balance. Next morning I waited over and hour for the motor to be pressure washed like he promised it would be done yesterday by lunch. While waiting he then decided that he would for free replace the master cylinder and patch the fuel tank leak with a $6.00 putty instead of replacing the tank like I asked on day one. All while repairs being done there were no actual receipt/list of parts and labor but guesstimations made until I made final payment. After I reviewed the receipt just before I paid the remaining $1,400+ balance I had to request that Matt break down and fix the double charges on receipt (I was so angry that I missed a few issues on the receipt). A week turned into a month and if I had not stopped the work there’s no telling how long it would have taken to get the van back. Now I’m weeks behind schedule on preparing for the van for body work and getting it wrapped.   The total cost was $3,863.68 and $1,417.25 of it was labor. I felt robbed and played. This place is not worthy of your money and will waste your time…. so please be advised! You are WARNED!!
CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS

H Russell Adair II
White 1984 Chevrolet P30 Step Van

P.S.
I was charged $30.00 for brake fluid even though he knew the master cylinder was bad. I realized this after I paid. Also, the paper work was drawn up and balance paid before he decided to replace master cylinder.
Matt told me the only man allowed to work on my vehicle had taken off several days due to court date and illness hence why the time frame was pushed back.
He spoke negatively about customers in front of me while they were on hold with the receptionist who also was not professional.

resp.text:

We are sorry that you are not happy-- our customers are very important to us. In all fairness, when the vehicle was diagnosed the owner did recommend that you not repair it because the repairs would be more than the vehicle was worth. Considering you had just purchased it, and it was a 1984, you didn’t know how well it was maintained hence lots of wear and tear does equal extensive repairs. Again we are very sorry and would like the opportunity to speak with you. Please call us at 205-786-8279. Thanks.

name: Cale Lockhart
text: Take your car and money somewhere else, like Green Garage. TAPCO kept my car for over a week while making no attempts to contact and update me on the repair details. I had to call them daily. They did not give me an estimate for the repair and I was stuck with a $200 bill after paying them $300 the week prior. I went in for a new belt and to look at an oil leak and $500 later and my oil light is still on. Also they misgendered me (transman) the entire transaction. Very cool. Also your car will be sitting outside unlocked after they have worked on it.

resp.text: Cale, I apologize that you felt mistreated. You brought the vehicle in for the oil leak and we found your axle seal to be leaking. This is on the transmission side of your vehicle. The seal was replaced and you also requested a new drive belt which we happily installed for you. I advised you that there may be further oil leaks, and we would need to keep an eye on it and to bring it back in if oil was still visibly leaking on the ground. You had the vehicle towed in for a no start issue. After 3 hours of diagnosis not charged to you, we found that there was an ECM update needed for the vehicle. This is not a service we provide, and I know the advisor informed you that we were waiting on the programmer to come and flash the ECM. The advisor should of given you a rough estimate of cost for this service and I apologize he did not. We also did not know what the cost would be for the service because it has ranged from $45.00 to $400 in the past. So as we knew the fix, the cost was out of our hands. Once the programmer arrived, he performed the flash on the ECM, the vehicle cranked, and he gave me a bill for $200. We called you, let you know the vehicle was repaired and the cost was $200. We literally did not make one dime off of you, and spent 3 hours of diagnosing to confirm we had the right fix for you ( Normally a $345 cost). If your oil light is still on, then you may have another oil leak on the engine side and would need to address that issue, just as I advised you personally. As far as misgendering, we apologize, not really sure what else to say. We will do better with that situation as a whole. We apologize again for the way you feel. We were just doing our best to get your vehicle back in your hands, at the cheapest cost possible. We are not magicians, nor fortune tellers. We do not control when a vehicle breaks, or what mechanical part may fail and start leaking. All we do is advise the best path forward with as much information as we have to give the customer the best chance to make the right decision for themselves. Thank you for business. Please let us know if we can further assist you with your cars in the future.

name: Mark Paxton
text: I had an excellent experience with TAPCO on a '96 FZJ80 restoration.  They did a complete engine rebuild, turbo charger upgrade, roof rack installation, OME springs, powder coated factory rims, installed a front bumper, welded a custom rear bumper, and tons of NAPA service parts bringing this 21 year old SUV back to life.  They are a first class automotive service and repair company with talented techs and ownership that can fix your daily driver or build your one of kind custom builds.  Great work, exceptional service, at a fair price.

name: Scott Jackson
text: I stumbled across TAPCO on youtube while finding out what was involved in swapping the body mounts out on my F250. Along with body mounts, my truck needed new wheel hub assemblies and just someone to go over the steering issues i've had for some time, that several shops have looked at and never been able to diagnose. They were able to swap everything out and found a few things I was not aware of were contributing to the slack in my steering. The combination of fixed steering issues and the S&B body mounts, my 240k mile F250 feels like its a 40k mile truck! TAPCO gave great service, communication, and very fair rates for the amount of work done. Would highly recommend them!

resp.text: Appreciate the kind words Scott! We hope your truck is riding great!!

name: Ritesh Sevalkar
text: The service was quick and my car issue was resolved. I am satisfied with the place and would recommend it.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Max Hibbard
text: Been going for there for years now and they've never let me down. Reasonable pricing and they care about the work. Always get the job done well

resp.text: Thank you Max! Always a pleasure!

name: Arthur Tillman
text: I went in to get my vehicle fixed. I normally work on my car myself, but am willing to pay others to do so when problems are above my experience. I asked them to fix whatever it was that made the check engine light be on, which I knew was something with the vacuum system. I also asked them to fix two windows that weren’t working. They “fixed” my car and gave it back to me. Well on my drive home, I discovered a rat chewed halfway through my seat belt and left dropping in the floorboard that they did not clean up. The next day I let them know when I got off work and they said to bring it in and they would fix it. And they did, but they replaced my seatbelt with a black one and my interior is grey. When they replaced my window regulators, they left metal chips from drilling all in my carpet and leather interior, so they did not do a clean job and did not clean up after themselves. ALSO, my check engine light came back on and was running the same codes as it was before I brought it to them. So then I had to leave it with them for several more days. They had my car for over one week. One last thing is that my driver window was tight before they serviced it and made no road noise. Now, it leaks air over fifty and I don’t want to have to bring the car back to them for a third time. That same door now makes an awful rattling noise when it shuts, which it also did not do before they touched my car. I have had pleasant experiences with them in the past, and I left reviews those times as well but service was not what it use to be this visit.

resp.text:
Arthur,
Sorry to hear about your displeasure with our work. Lets start from the top. The vehicle was brought in after you personally attempted to repair many issues with the vehicle yourself and admitted that you may have done something wrong as everything you had done has still not fixed it and the same check engine lights remain on and the vehicle was running rough, even after you worked on it personally. We used our extensive diagnostic equipment and found multiple leaks throughout your vehicles intake system. I personally called and told you we had found these leaks and would need to take off the intake manifold you just put on yourself to see what was going on under it, as that is where the main leak was. I also notified you that there was an code in your ecu for the EGR system and that it may be triggered by the massive intake leak and we would need to correct the major leak first, and let you drive the vehicle to see if there was still an issue with the EGR system. The EGR Valve was also covered with epoxy from what looked to be a band aid repair from a previous time. This could be an issue, but during the diagnosis we did check each component of the system and did confirm the actuators and the valves were operating as they should.  Once we had your approval for the work, we moved forward. Once the intake manifold was removed, we found that you had left the old intake gaskets on the engine and also used the new gaskets of the intake manifold you just replaced. This is what we call being "double gasketed" and quickly saw this was the issue with the massive intake leak. We purchased new intake gaskets since the new ones you installed were severely damaged. We removed the old gaskets and cleaned the surface to ensure proper sealing on installation. Everything went together very smooth on the install and a quick smoke test found that the leak was no longer and the issue was repaired. The codes were cleared and the vehicle was test driven and confirmed that the vehicle was running properly and no longer had any further codes in the system. You were called and told the good news and were made aware that the EGR valve was still in question but would need significant miles put on it to be addressed. Once you took the vehicle and drove it, the light came back on and when you brought it back in we found that the same EGR code was back and found that the EGR Valve that you epoxied was blocking the air passage and triggering the light. You were not charged any further diagnosis and we repaired the EGR valve and there was no further issue.

After these issues were handled you requested that we look at your windows. The window regulators were found to be the issue at hand and they are riveted in from the factory and are very difficult to perfect. We Use OEM ford rivets and installed them to perfection with the factory holes in the door that were not modified in any way shape or form. I do apologize there is wind noise with the window now, we would be glad to take care of this issue and resolve it for you at no cost.  I was also not aware of the pieces in the floor that were claimed to be left by us, and I sincerely apologize for the possible mess left behind. I would be glad to provide a complimentary vacuum of your interior from a detail shop of your choosing. There was a good bit of mess on the floor, including crumbs and such, so we may of overlooked what mess we made, versus what mess was there before we began our work.

The seatbelt issue. We have never had a rat issue before at this location. We have been here for 8 years and never once faced an issue of the sort. We have biweekly pest control services done and stay very proactive with pest control due to the known issues of old downtown buildings and sewer systems. When brought to our concern, we replaced your belt with an OEM Ford part and purchased it by your VIN number at no cost. The interior in your vehicle was sun faded and that is why there is a color difference.

name: Kevin Sandlin
text: Don't go here. They charged my daughter $100 to tell her that her check engine light meant her gas cap was loose. If they'll take advantage of a 19 y/o girl who's out of state, what else do you think they'll do? Seriously: $100 to read a check engine light code and (literally) tighten a gas cap. #epicfail

resp.text: Kevin, I believe you may not fully understand the process of diagnosis on a vehicle. We take pride in our diagnosis and ensure the diagnosis is correct before we tell a customer any type of estimate. Our standard diagnostic rate is $100 and we roll that fee into the repair if you decided to do the repair with us. We have signage throughout the main office with this verbiage and discuss the process with customers as they drop a vehicle off. But yes, lets walk through it so you and everyone can understand. First, we read that check engine light on the vehicle, and used the $6500.00 computer scanner to do so. We went through and found every lasting detail on the issue down to the date it happened and how often it happened. That is where Autozone stops. They get their $30 scan tool out and tell you 10 guesses of items it could be. So now that we have a lot of data, and approved $100 of diagnostic work on the vehicle ( up to 1 hour of diagnosis ) we can move forward and start using our years of training and knowledge to properly diagnose your vehicle. Now my technician gets out his smoke machine (a $1600 tool)  that pressurizes your daughters Evap Emissions system and also fills the system with smoke so we can determine if there is a leak on the system. Then we put the vehicle on our $4500 lift to ensure that we inspect every inch of the system that has a fault. We also use the scanner in the above mentioned process to activate all of the solenoids of the evap system to ensure they are working properly and letting the system properly work. So now that we have used our multi thousand dollars in tools and years of knowledge that is priceless, we have determined your daughters system is actually in perfectly working condition and the only fault is that a personal mistake happened of someone leaving the gas cap loose! Whew! Seems like quite a lot for such a simple task, right?  Well what if you went by the local auto parts store, got a free scan on the vehicle and they sold you an evap canister for your daughters vehicle and then you take it somewhere for an install and spend $1000.00 and the same problem remains. I am sure this review would look a lot different if you took into consideration the time, the effort, the knowledge, and the care that was put into your 19 year olds daughter vehicle to ensure we did not sell her any parts or service she did not need and made sure she was getting the most honest and best value possible when she put her trust in our shop. I apologize you feel like we took advantage of her. I hope that you see we spent a careful amount of time ensuring we had a proper diagnosis, and realize that doing so does not come free. This business is how we feed our families and have done so for 8 years. If we did not charge customers for diagnosis, then we would become a charity, and likely go out of business, and your daughter would be stuck down the street at the dishonest shop that sold her thousands in repair work that was not needed. I am certainly glad to hear your daughters vehicle is still doing well and the check engine light has not come back on after our thorough diagnosis, with out costing her any extra money.  If you would like to further discuss this issue you are welcome to call me, Michael Lee, the owner whenever you would like to. I would be glad to walk you through our process and make sure you fully understand the extent of work we did ensuring your daughters vehicle was safe and properly diagnosed and why the $100.00 was charged. Most would consider it an #epicsave , you know, since we were the honest shop that did not take advantage of her and took every possible step to make sure her vehicle was diagnosed properly. Happy Holidays.

text: I highly recommend TAPCO! Great service! Jeremy and Michael and the guys do great work and are very reasonable on pricing. name: william powell
text:
One Word for this place "HONEST"
Great Customer Service, Friendly.
Did I say HONEST well they are .I'm A 1st. time customer had a problem with BMW 535i was told by another shop I needed a battery for the car.
TAPCO told me I needed a battery for my remote . Keyless remote battery from Wal-mart $2.75 Car battery from other shop $300.00 . GUESS what it was "the remote." They could have told me yelp you need the $300.00 battery but they didn't. Also had a check engine light on, they checked that , cleared the data. Saying that the remote caused the entrees. Did I say HONEST well they are. Again with all the data on the check engine light they could've had my car in their shop for a month with a bill that would put in the poor house. But No being HONEST told me to watch the car and replace my remote battery.
Honestly the Best Place I've taken any car. Tell Jeremy I said Thanks !

I found them from good Google reviews, so I'll leave a good Google review. 5 stars.

name: Shirrell Moore
text: I will never take my truck or car there again,I took my SUV in because the brakes kept going to the floor,when I brought it to them the assured me that they can fix it,after he called me and told me it was ready to be picked up the brakes went slap to the floor so I left it with them 2 weeks then he called and asked me why I didn't tell him I put a brake booster on it I told him I didn't know what was put on there then he charge me again to put a brake booster on there,now he already put a master cylinder the first time that was the first thing he said was wrong with it but it wasn't the problem and I paid him 324.00 the second time 370.00 when he put the brake booster on it went up long enough to get it home when I got back in town I went to drive it coming off the interstate the brakes went slap out when I took it back to him on Monday morning trying to get him to fix it or give my money back he told me my godbrother sign a no warranty,but I told him he didn't suppose to let no body sign nothing if his name wasn't on it,I asked him to contact me cause when I first took it to Tapco I sign a warranty for 12 months or 12 000 miles but since it wasn't fixed properly he didn't want to honor the warranty he originally gave me now I'm out 700.00 and my brakes are the same when I first came I really feel robbed without a weapon, but I'mspeaking with my attorney!

resp.text:
It is unfortunate that you would not tell the entire truth here and try and lie for personal gain. Your vehicle left with working brakes and came back 3 times with working brakes. (Video Evidence) Your brother inspected, test drove, and then
signed off on the vehicle being repaired and working properly, and agreeing to the no warranty (mainly because you brought us used parts to install on your vehicle). This is all after the lies that were told about the vehicle and trying to throw us under the bus after multiple shops had unsuccessfully repaired your vehicle. I hope you are leaving the other shops that worked on your vehicle bad reviews and threatening them with attorneys as well, after all, they could not even repair your vehicle.  Before we even installed parts on the vehicle you threatened attorneys for some reason. We should of turned you away then, instead we repaired vehicle properly.  I am sorry you are so upset. We do not turn out incomplete work. Our endless reviews on here and Facebook, and your brother signing off on our work after a thorough inspection are proof to my statement.

Also, NAPA Autocare provides a nationwide warranty for our customers. I would recommend calling another NAPA Autocare center in the area that will accept your business. I ask that you treat them with respect and be up front with them from the beginning and don’t threaten their every move with lawsuits.

It is unfortunate that Google will not let businesses review customers.

I will gladly accept your 1 star review. Thank you!

Jeremy immediately went out, diagnosed the (non)issue from sound alone, and off I went. In and out in 5 minutes and now I've got peace of mind. Still a solid 5 star review from me.

Additionally, they did not push me to fix or change anything I was not ready to do and spent time discussing the pros and cons of fixing or not fixing a part. They went out of their way to test drive my car after fixing the starter to ensure it ran correctly and went above and beyond to contact Honda to find my radio code. The employees at Tapco made this a painless and pleasant experience. I trust them completely and can honestly say they are the only auto company I will deal with again.

name: Adam Mattes
text: Went to get a misfire diagnosed and no suprise they diagnosed me with a misfire but wouldn't tell me anything past that. Instead they wanted $1200 to replace my spark plugs (they had just been replaced), spark plug wires, and clean my throttle body. A quick look at the throttle body would have told them it was clean. A quick look at the spark plugs would have told you they were correct and attaching a multimeter to the wires can tell you if they pass. They did not check my fuel pressure (takes 2 seconds with the proper tool) or my fuel injectors and did not check the camshaft position sensor which I think (again I didnt get it diagnosed) is wrong. They will say I refused further diagnosis when I refused replacement of everything but what I really refused is their poor excuse of what I diagnosed is. My though is take your money and run I can learn what they told me just sitting in my driveway.

text: I live in Florida and found a Jeep Wrangler they had there online. Before I left, I called to make sure it was still there. Mr. Ricky Jones said "let me call you right back, I'm going to walk out there and put my eyes on it before I tell you to drive 3 hours up here." He called back within 10 minutes and told me he had pulled it off the lot and to come on. That started how great the service and experience was there. Everyone was super friendly and personable. I didn't feel like I was being hustled or pressured into buying anything. Even though they aren't a Jeep dealership, they knew the answers to my questions regarding the jeep. I ended up buying it and couldn't have had a better experience, all the way from Mr Ricky in sales to AJ in finance office. Super easy buying experience!

text: I drove from Mississippi to Montgomery Alabama to purchase a pre owned hyundai elantra from Capitol Chevrolet of Montgomery. It was priced $4000 below retail.  I worked specifically with Quenita Mitchell, and S M Harris, who went out of their way to make sure I received the best deal possible. The facilities are very nice, and the staff is extremely friendly knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Giuliana Marie Marinucci
text: I went in to look at the 2018 Traverse on 9/16/2017. When I arrived, I was looking at the vehicle from the outside in before being approached by a salesperson. When the lady finally came up to assist me, I asked if I could look inside of the vehicle - if she had the keys - because the truck was locked. She told me "no" but she could take me inside and give me the specs for the vehicle from the tablet. Ok, fine... thats good for the moment. We get in and she starts running numbers on what the payment would be and telling me what the truck had it in based on what was on her tablet... disregarding the fact I asked her multiple times to go outside and get it unlocked so that I could get inside of it and look. I know what I can afford, I already did the numbers before I got here. All I wanted to do was look at it and see if it fit my family's needs. She finally unlocked it but when I started touching the touch screen she yelled at me like I was a kid even though there was little damage I could do to the vehicle (not that it was my intentions but) since the vehicle was in demo mode. I was also not allowed to sit in the drivers seat. She had told me multiple times that the truck was out of my price range, knowing NOTHING about my finances because I had not yet disclosed that information in any form. Then she had the "manager" come out and he told me the same thing, that I couldnt afford this vehicle but they could put me in a cheaper vehicle. Long story short, they lost a purchase from a client who makes over $100k per year because "I couldnt afford that vehicle". We will take out business on to Prattville to the Chevy dealer up here when they get the 2018 Traverse in stock.

name: Jacey B.
text:
I just want to start out by saying that the employees here all seem very genuine and caring, and they’re probably great with most vehicles. But do not bother taking any foreign vehicle to their shop that needs anything more than an oil change. I had a vehicle break down on me and took it here to avoid towing it to the dealership in Birmingham. I quickly received an estimate of almost $23,000 to fix my suv and was told that I should contact my insurance company because it was totaled.

I ended up taking it to the dealership for a second opinion (like I should have to begin with) and ended up only paying $3700 to repair what was wrong with my suv, and that didn’t include a single thing listed on the original estimate sent to me by CBA.

I really wish they would have just turned me away before I took it there in the first place if they could not service my vehicle instead of guessing what the problem was and writing it off as a lost cause.

I called CBA last week to update them on the status of my vehicle and to let them know what really was wrong with it - all they wanted to know was how “reputable the shop was that I took my vehicle to” and to try to tell me that they never referred to my car as totaled. Not only did they put us in a horrible situation, they also tried to act like they never said the things they did and asked what exactly I was expecting from my phone call. Just a bad experience.

resp.text: We apologize for your inconvenience, Jacey. Your feedback is appreciated, and we wish you well with all your future automotive repairs and services. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: UpInTheAir
text:
I'd like to start off this review by saying that the folks at CBA Montgomery are incredibly polite and courteous. I have no disapproval towards the individual employees there.

With that said, that is unfortunately the extent of my positives about the business. I've brought two of my vehicles there a total of three times, over the course of two years, and each time, I have been disappointed. My first vehicle had a minor oil leak, and I took it to CBA to check it out. Long story short, they charged me over $1000 and a week of time, and in the end, the issue wasn't resolved. Brought my vehicle to another shop on Atl Highway, $250 later, and it was fixed. All in all, this wasn't a huge deal, but I was disappointed in CBA.

Fast forward 2 years, and i take another one of my vehicles that I had just purchased to CBA for a post-purchase full diagnosis (This alone cost $120) which they assured me would cover just about everything i needed to get done to the vehicle to get it to top shape. They quoted me over $5,000 worth of service. This alone wasn't completely insane. It was an older vehicle, and yes, a good few things needed fixing. However, I jotted down the items they told me I needed to replace and decided to do the items myself (brake change, coolant flush, oil change, filters, etc). Took off the brakes. The Pads, Rotors were literally brand new. They said my front caliper mount and caliper itself were in terrible condition. Completely false--it was in perfect condition upon further inspection. Performed the coolant change after they claimed it was dirty and needed changing (btw they quoted me $140 for the coolant change, which if you know, is one of the easiest things you can do yourself for $20 worth of coolant and 30 min of your time max). This also turned out to be unecessary. The coolant I drained was the exact same color as the new coolant I purchased myself. I did this for every item on the list of things they told me I needed to change, and the ONLY thing that actually needed to be changed was the front driver struts and the radiator fan.

A week after I get the $5000 list of things that need to be serviced, I drive to Atlanta. Halfway there on the interstate, my timing/fan belt shred apart, engine overheats, and my car is disabled. Tow it to a garage nearby and they inform me that my water pump was well on its way out, A/C compressor had imploded, and timing/fan belts should have been changed a long time ago. NONE OF THESE WERE MENTIONED BY CBA. Fortunately I did not get into an accident, but I trusted CBA to diagnose what I needed to fix on my vehicle, and they failed to mention, at all, three incredibly easy to inspect components that were failing, and caused my vehicle to stop driving in the middle of the highway. Absolutely unacceptable.

If you're reading this, CBA, come on, step your game up. If you're going to charge one of the highest rates in the entire state of Alabama, maybe provide service that backs up that rate. I respect you all as individuals, but  as a "reputable automotive service center", I am appalled.

resp.text: We take your detailed feedback seriously, as our customers' safety and satisfaction are very important to us. However, we are unable to find your information in our database so there is a chance you have left this for the wrong business. Please allow us an opportunity to address your concerns in detail by sending your phone number and availability to Eric.Wesch@cbauto.net. Thank you for your time, and we hope to hear from you soon. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

The “nice” factor is great but I’d rather have competitive prices.

resp.text: Travis, I am truly sorry that we failed to meet your needs in the pricing of our services. We take pride in everything we do although I can not speak to the services and pricing of other repair facilities. Our expectation is to offer premium quality services accompanied with our Nice Difference Warranty which is a 2 year or 24,000 mile warranty on all our repairs. Again I am sorry we were unable to meet your expectations but if there's anything we can do for you in the future please let us know.

text:
There are not enough stars to rate this company.
2 weeks ago my car broke down, following a long string of misfortunes, I felt utterly hopeless and on the verge of just giving up. I came across the number to CBA while trying to find a repair shop that could quote me less than the few $1000 I had already been quoted by another. CBA was the only other shop I called, as soon as Danny answered my call he said he knew he had to help me, not to worry, they would do everything they could to get me through this. He did. He helped me get it towed from Prattville to their shop in Montgomery. Kept me updated every step of the way and constantly reassured me that they were there to help. My car, unfortunately, had some very major issues and even at CBA prices still was out of my price range. But, I didn't leave without transportation. Danny went above and beyond to help me find a suitable vehicle that I could afford and I left yesterday the owner of a reliable, running vehicle. The people of CBA are some of the kindest people I have had the blessing of meeting. They are truly doing works that reflect the epitome of Christians. Neither my family nor I will never not take a vehicle anywhere else other than Christian Brothers Automotive.
Thank you Danny and all the staff at CBA! I am forever grateful.

resp.text:
Being there for our customers when they need us is something our team takes great pride in, and it was truly our pleasure to be of help to you. Thank you very much for taking the time to share your great experience and acknowledge the diligent efforts of our team, and please know you can expect the same above and beyond service from us in the future.

Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: Keith Poche
text: Horrible service. I called them at 10:30 am to schedule a time to bring my vehicle in for an oil change. They told me to be there at 1:00 pm. I was there 10 minutes early. Finally after waiting a hour. They tell me they don't have have the oil filter to change my oil.

name: Joe Florida
text:
The name of this place really bothers me, and reminds me of the money changers in the temple. They are just using "Christian Brothers" for marketing purposes, not to show a genuine Christian nature. I went in for an alternator swap. I knew it was the alternator and told them as much; didn't stop them from charging me $48 to "diagnose" the problem. That was for an half hour of labor which if you want to count the time it took for them to tell me the price, was not a half hour after I brought it in. So yes, their hourly labor rate is $96 which strikes me as a little high, and yes, they don’t mind rounding up to the detriment of the customer. The rest of the bill was just as offensive and out of tune with normal auto repair prices. A re-manufactured alternator for my car was $117 at the time, they charged $244.20 and kept the core fee for themselves. No, they didn't put a new one in, just a re-man. They then charged me $39.78 for a serpentine belt, which I don't mind that they replaced, but a new one at any auto parts store runs around $20. So paying twice for parts is pretty painful, but then they add on a fee for "shop supplies"; I'm not sure what for, wear and tear on the tools? A paper towel or two? Whatever they were, they cost me $37.10. You'd think that "shop supplies" would be included when you pay premium for the parts and labor. On top of all of that, they padded the hours they were replacing the alternator. They charged me for 1.5 hours ($144.09) but the guy was only working on it for 45 minutes tops. The rest of the time that it was in their garage it just sat there. That's right, a car in Christian Brothers Automotive's garage is accruing labor costs even if it just sits there, hate to see what the overnight tab would be. Just think of the “shop supplies” that leaked into a car that sat there overnight.

They have three salesman upfront and only two technicians when I was there. This shows their focus: extract every possible penny from a potential customer, especially if he is from out of town. Why pay extra techs when you are still billing for the time that the car sits in their garage right? Another indication of their less-than-honest nature is that they put all these odd-ball prices on the parts and shop fees. Like what is with the 10 cents on shop supplies, they couldn't round that off? Well they could, but they don't want you to realize that they are just padding the bill. Ten cents looks more authentic. They also have a sign in the back that says: "Ask every customer: Is there anything else we can check for you today?" I'd hate to see the proposal for work you get back when you give these guys a greenlight to check out your entire car.

The technicians were good, the alternator seems to be working out fine. But the salesmen are only good at small talk. They brought my car back out of the garage and it started to smoke. They thought the engine was about to explode or something they turn it off and frantically check the oil. When I get out there they say that the oil pan is empty. Nope, check again. When they checked again they saw that it was half full like I knew it was. The smoke was from the debris that got knocked down onto the serpentine belt. Some debris that my $37.10 in shop supplies should have cleaned up. Guess not.

All-in-all, I paid $545 for a pretty simple fix, and they quoted me on the phone $250 as I was driving trying to get somewhere before my car died. I guess they knew they had me, but I hope this review saves somebody else the expense and frustration of dealing with these guys. These guys bend you over with a smile on their face. If you want this type of service and pay these type of prices, just go to the dealer, at least they are more knowledgeable about your car.

name: Barbara Eaves

name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Walt H
text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

text: At first I thought they did a great job for a great price. My car wouldn't start and I wasn't sure why. I took it in and found out the battery cables were loose. name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: I gave one star because the girl at front is very sweet and there was a helpful guy, but we left car on a Wednesday at 10am. I explained we really needed the car asap because I have cancer and lupus etc and will be hard for me to give people rides to work etc at 5am! They explain there was cars in front of mine (6) Thursday it was to be done...nope! Friday the were sure by then...NO, the mechanic that looked at it had left for the day and weekend. The other mechanics had jobs and they couldn't get to mine...nothing! They need a mechanic for minor jobs like mine (bearings to be replaced) and other mechanics for the bigger jobs...if you got one car and need it done same or next day or actually in three ...don't go here! I feel the mechanic that looked at the car should have just fixed it. Oh they were supposed to have called as well..no such thing happened, the mechanic just didn't want to do the job! I have never taken a car somewhere where they did not have their stuff together like this place! Never even called for a status update or to tell us anything about the car! Taking car to another place who can have work done in one hour!!! The car set there for 3 days!!!!!

name: Carole Juarez
text: Amazing company!!!  We were referred by discount tire. Polite hard-working people. Thank you for putting us back on the road so quickly. Feeling safe Carole

name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

name: Kristina Garrison
text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

I tried calling them and got hung up on so when I drove up there they were all laying around on couches doing nothing. The guy was rude and the mechanic didn't even know where he had put the keys at. text: I highly recommend this place! My Mom and I were on our way to Charlotte, NC and were planning a night stay in Montgomery. Our battery light on the dashboard came on about 50 miles out. text: Even though they weren't able to help with my recent request, Lawrence was kind and knowledgeable. Have used this company in the past, work was done properly the first time. Can't recommend enough!

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Parrish. Hopefully we can help next time!

name: James Mason
text: Excellent service. Great folks to work with.Quality work with quick turnaround.  I recommend this auto service to everyone on the capital district area.

name: Alexander Hatch
text: Probably never letting my dealership touch my car again

name: Kama Mason
text: I highly recommend this auto repair shop.. Brandon, the shop supervisor and fellow workers are always willing to help in any way they can. They are up front with the problem and do their best to make it right.

resp.text: Mrs. Mason, thank you for the review! We strive to be honest and upfront with our customers. We look forward to seeing you and Mr. Mason.

name: Robert Annibale
text: Overall great experience and very satisfied with the work done on my truck. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Annibale. Your truck looks great!  It was our pleasure!

name: Greg Hardy
text: Fast, friendly quality service at a fair price. Can't ask for much more than that.

name: Patrick Tidwell
text: Good job with my battery when I needed a new one despite what AAA said

name: Survive N Thrive
text: Went here with a truck, had tire fixed in a reasonable time. Staff was friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you, let us know if we can help in the future.

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

name: Alice Yelder
text: Had a f250 lifted on fri may 31, I was very disappointed I wanted truck lifted because it was scrubbing, the people there lifted truck like I asked but truck tires were still scrubbing so we asked why someone didn't call since that was the reason we took it there, they weren't concerned about the quality of the work or did it solve the problem they just took the money. This was the first and last time we will ever use them. There expertise should've been used and should've reached out to us and have customer service and just plain sense but all they could see was money. What about fixing the problem and all they could tell us was "we did what you asked", what great regard for customers

resp.text: We’re very sorry that you feel like you had a bad experience. We strive to have good customer service. Give us a call Monday morning or if you’d like, we can call you and we will do what we can to change your experience.

name: Majyst Thalsbane
text: The service was great. I replaced all tje suspension components on my car o er the weekend. I came in and wanted a performance alignment specific to my car and suspension setup. They were able to get extremely close to the measurements, which is normal as all cars are not capable of achieving the perfect requirements. The technician that worked on my car "fixed" a few issues from the work and informed me of the issues. This was a free set of extra eyes. The price was reasonable for the work performed, they basically had to 4 wheel align twice because of the extensive work done to the suspension.  I definately recommend Performance Auto Repair. I will be bringing my other project cars here for similar service.

name: Brian Barth
text: Aaron and staff are great to deal with. Always take our company trucks there and are very pleased with their service. Anything we ask for they always are there for us. Thank you guys!

resp.text: Mr. Barth, Thank you for the review. It is our pleasure taking care of ALL of your fleet maintenance needs.

name: Troy Brown
text: Cant fix foriegn cars

resp.text: Mr. Brown, we are sorry that you did not have a 5 Star experience with Performance Auto Repair. You can give us a call at 334-260-3582 and we will try to help in any way we can.

name: Thomas Davis
text: Had a bad experience was going to work when my box truck lost electrical power and went dead Lawrence Robinson service advisor said it will be $640.00 to fix it was a month for them to call and say it was the alternator and called back saying that thay was trying to crank it and even trying starting fluids which is not good for diesels now truck needs a starter and flywheel that it will $2,500.00 it cost me $640.00 to get my truck back not fixed now i have more problems than i started with

name: Jack Harrington
text: At times my pickup would misfire and lose power. After reading my Nissan check engine light code, Performance Auto Repair replaced the catalytic converter. The check engine light was not on and the truck had a lot more power. However, the truck continued to occasionally misfire and start loosing power. This would last from 1 minute to several minutes before resuming with good power. Without any engine codes indicating the issue, they continued to search for the problem.  The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence!  I will be using them for future repairs/service. I will recommend to friends.

name: atcarter75
text: Greated at the door immediately, and the staff had expert advice.

resp.text: Thank you, we're here to help if we can.

name: Bob Atchison
text:
Prior to my recent visits I’d never used this business.  When I walked in I was greeted by no less than two people.

Zack greeted me and asked how he could help.  From that point forward he was very accommodating and helpful.  He would pull the products up on the computer that I was interested in and show me what they looked like on the vehile.  He made excellent suggestions and made it easy to get just what I needed.

The prices were good and the service excellent.  I would highly reccomend Proformance Auto Repair.  Ask for Zack and you’ll be sure to receive excellent service.

Bob

name: Jamie Jamison
text: I have dealt with mostly Lawrence. He is one of the most concerned, considerate and professional sales and service providers at performance.  I would highly recommended this company to anyone. Especially military.  I am retired military to include law enforcement. This is a great company.  Keep up the grand work.

name: Michael Britton
text: These guys take care of my work beast. No matter the repair or maintenance issue. I’m in and out with little to no interruption of my work day. This place rocks. I was allowing Gipson’s to do my service work. I will never allow that to happen as long as Performance is open for business.

resp.text: Mr. Britton, thank you for the review and for your business. It is an honor to take care of your vehicle and at Performance Auto Repair we take pride in doing so in a timely manner and for a fair price.

name: Terrence Coleman (tcoleman701)
text: Was having problems getting my Putco Switchblade Tailgate Bar installed at other places (the dreaded "we only service or install what we sell" spill). However, the guys at Performance Auto were more than willing to install it and my Tailgate Assist on my 2016 Ram 1500 without hesitation and they performed an excellent job! I made sure to get a business card because I most definitely will be a regular customer! Awesome group of guys! Highly recommend for all of your auto needs!

name: Whitney Banks
text: Remember the $400 your company took from me by the second visit for one wheel bearing? Well, I’m being told that the bearing is still bad.

resp.text: Ms. Banks, we strive to perform quality work and make sure that our customers are happy. If one of the wheel bearings that we replaced back in 2017 is bad, it could possibly still be under warranty. Give us a call at (334) 245-6600 and we will gladly set up an appointment for you to come in and we will check it out for you.

name: Rob Rance
text: I strongly recommend this place.  You can find what you want for your truck at reasonable prices with great service.  Their auto technicians are qualified and skilled.  They do both car repair and truck repair which I didn't know till I visited.

name: Tina Stanley
text: My family takes all of our automobiles to Performance Truck & Automotive.  The staff there is very professional, courteous and friendly.  They  always provide quick and great service.  They go out of their way to provide excellent customer service.

name: Audrae Mayo
text:
My boyfriend and I traveled from Kansas City to Montgomery, AL for a business trip last Friday and Saturday.  Unexpectedly, our front brakes went bad, really fast.  I found them by Google, took it in without an appointment on Saturday morning and was done and out within 1.5 hours.  Very friendly and professional.  I did not feel like they were taking advantage of "out-of-town, desperate" travelers.
Lawrence was very helpful, courteous and genuine!!!!  I even received a follow-up call to make sure everything was good and that we made it home safely.  THANK YOU!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

name: S D Butcher (AdventureFamilyInMotion)
text: AWESOME work! Wonderful staff! We looked at the local reviews online before choosing Performance Truck and Automotive Repair and their reputation is legit! Fast, precise, and friendly! There is even a toy chest with toys for kids to play with! I will be back!!! Thank you for your work!

name: Chandler Bise
text: Just got brand new tires on my 13 Jeep JKU. The guys here did an amazing job, correctly on the first time. Ill definitely be coming back for any more work done to my vehicles.

name: Cody Greene
text: I work for Admiral Movers so keeping our fleet of vehicles in check is a key part of our success. Performance Auto does all of our fleet vehicle repairs and maintenance at a very affordable price. I would highly recommend them for any job.

name: Denise Jacobson
text: I have been through 3 different vehicles in 4 years but I haven't changed where I go for automotive repair.  Performance Truck & Automotive takes care of my vehicle.  They communicate clearly my vehicle repair needs, offer fair pricing and the best part is they pick up my vehicle and bring it back when they are done.

name: Jac Chapman
text:
Amazing service and amazing people. You can't beat them. My truck is driving and shifting great.
Thanks for the help.
J. Chapman

name: Lynn Henry
text: I have been very impressed with Performance Truck.  They know a lot about fixing cars and work on them till the job is finished.  Their customer service is excellent and everyone that I have met there is friendly and nice.  Great folks!

name: Joshua Fields
text: Go to vendor for just about everything including light body work. Can't speak highly enough of the service. Would recommend to anyone. I take my personal vehicles and all of my fleet vehicles over.

name: Mike Dean
text: I sat in the lobby for an hour and a half before they told me that they didn't have my size tire and that they should be here any moment. Could have told me a lot sooner. Poor customer service. Will not go back. UPDATED!! I received a call from Lawrence shortly after posting my review. He apologized and was very swift in taking care of me for my inconvenience. That is how you manage your business. They will continue to get my business. Highly recommended! Thanks Lawrence.

name: Venessa Menefee
text: My experience at Performance was superb! The people were very professional, knowlegable and courteous. I trust their work and opinion when it comes to my vehicle. I will come back when I am in need of any type of service on my vehicle.

name: Bonnie L Temple
text: Large regular maintenance time in Santa Fe.  Kept me informed and gave me estimate.  Enjoyable conversation with young man waiting.  Overall pleasant.

name: Dave Ely
text: My Subaru broke down on interstate 65 and AAA had my car towed to this shop.  After a 3 hrs wait for the AAA truck Lawrence saved the remainder of the day.  We had discussed by phone that my fan belt had broken; he took my vehicle information, ordered the part and had it delivered as we waited to arrive.  When we finally got to the shop they recommended a couple of near by restaurants and offered us a ride.  While eating they called to tell me the idler pulley seized and needed replacement.  We returned from lunch and with about 20 more minutes the car was ready to go.  I'd certainly return to this shop for repair work.

name: Lamon Logue
text: Outstanding service !! I was traveling through Montgomery Alabama and my fuel line busted. I almost made it to their shop breaking down just a block away. The service men where very courteous and made arrangements to get my truckto the shop. The rrepair was a difficult one due to the location of the line.They were extremely nice offering me and my girlfriend cold water on this hot summer day even arranged for us to get lunch. For me this is business done right. I wish they were local to me.

name: amanda smith
text: Lawrence, Aaron, and their team at Performance Auto Repair took an unfortunate situation and provided excellent service.

resp.text: Ms. Smith, I’m sorry for any inconvenience. Please email me at aaron11sprayberry@gmail.com and I will send you my phone number or you can email me your phone number so we can try to get this situation fixed ASAP.

name: Bob Wingenfield
text: I have used PTAR for more than 10 years for  my company and private vehicles for tires, periodic maintenance, as well as auto repair.  The staff is courteous and the mechanics treat your vehicle as if it was their own.  When service is required, a simple phone call will get your vehicle picked up, serviced and returned.   Service like that is hard to find these days.  Absolutely five stars for PTAR.

name: seyth smith
text:
Great service
Straight forward and was very pleased with the outcome of the work preformed

name: Rhonda Miller
text: I have a 2010 Silverado. Zach and the guys did an outstanding job on my truck. This is the second truck that I've had a lift installed by PTC. I didn't have the opportunity to meet the technician that installed the lift but none the less his work was flawless. I'm extremely happy with the looks and function of my truck. Thanks Zach.....

name: Raymond Head
text: The service and repair to my truck was done very proficiently. There was a problem after I got my tuck returned to me. When I took the truck back the problem was very quickly repaired and the staff was completely apologetic and helpful in supporting my schedule.

name: Buford Strength
text: Not friendly, everything I've tried to get there they have to order, expensive

text: I started going to them when I had a tow hitch put on my Saturn Vue, many years ago.  When the warranty ran out on my newer vehicle I noticed they had moved and started using them for a hitch on my current vehicle, oil changes and tire changes or any of my other automotive needs.  I am moving to NC and one thing I will regret is having to go through the hassle of finding another honest mechanic shop to service my automotive maintenance needs.  Great people, honest service.  Need I say more !!!!!!!  hey, they had breakfast the Tuesday I got my oil change and yesterday the coffee was good while they fixed a leaking tire.  Just a small screw in it.   But hey, it's fixed now.

name: colvin conway
text: I work for csx and they do a great job on our hi-rail vehicles, and all other maintenance.

name: Robert Jenkins
text: Front desk people are helpful and happy. Didn't want to pay for new rotors but they assured me it was time. I trust them so I went with it.

name: Joshua Carmichael
text: Performance Truck has always taking good care of our work truck and has made sure they do it right and fast so that they don't take up to much of our work day, so we can keep moving forward..Thanks, from the Ewing Team out of Montgomery

name: Camacho Family
text: These people really know what their doing and they are fair.  They told me up front what it would cost to get the job done.   Instead of cashing in, they explained that my truck was worth a whole lot less than the cost of the repairs.  Of course I did the google thing and started to research all they had told me was wrong with it.  Comparing Ebay prices and the average cost of labor in my area, and the book value of my car.  They were right.  The repairs would have cost more than the truck was worth. They saved me from the money pit that was my car.  I will be returning with all of my car maintenence and will highly recommend their team to anyone needing a honest mechanic.

name: Blackqueen70
text: My name is Tammera. PTC has performed nothing but exceptional service on my suv. They are friendly, knowledgeable and perform quality service on the level that you would expect from a dealership. Also, they are reasonably priced and have a fast service turn around. I highly recommend them to everybody!

text: They got my jeep up and running in no time, excellent service. I will definately be back. I had someone else look at it and they referred me to them.

Second service trip to PTC for repairs to my 3500 Dually; brakes this time.  Lawrence and I worked out what I needed to upgrade the performance for the heavy trailer I tow and came up with a perfect system.  Yes it was much more than most brake jobs but I wanted something that would last as well perform under towing conditions.

I was referred to PTC from fellow RVer and have been very happy with the quality of service and professionalism I receive from all the staff.  They are pros compared to the Chevy/GMC dealers I have dealt with over the years.

Because of their great service and quality I trust no others with the maintenance of my home hauler.

name: Shonn W.

I had an issue with my car that I thought was going to be a major issue but Performance Auto repair made it seem so little and they help solve my problem with ease .... Thanks so much I have found my new auto shop 🏪
😊😊

name: Shane Brown
text: Clean professional, better than the dealer.

name: Lamar Jackson
text: Knowledgeable crew.

name: Elise Allen
text: Got the most beautiful representatives on the planet.

name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

name: Javan Gray
text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful review, Javan! Exceptional work and exceptional service are what it's all about. Thanks for shouting out Hunter, Isaac, and the team. You can count on our crew to go the extra mile. Happy to hear about the great work on your vehicle!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

name: Amber Tall
text: I came in to get an oil change. I spoke with Andrew Boutwell. He was very professional, knowledgeable, honest, and respectful. Andrew and the technicians were very friendly and prompt. Andrew took time to explain what was work was needed on my vehicle. My wait time was not long. The store/shop was very well cleaned and kept up. The service was top notch and the prices were great! Definitely recommend going to Meineke Car Care Center on south parkway to see Andrew Boutwell.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Amber. Thanks for shouting out Andrew and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Dee Mulhall
text: Everyone was super nice. Took the time to explain work that was needed with the car Gave estimate of repairs needed. Wait time was not not long. Great shop

resp.text: Fast, professional, and the best. That's what we're about! Thank you for the review, Dee.

name: Mellissa Cowley
text:
worst experience ever. didn't authorize work they did. charged twice what is usual. rude mechanic. paid for diagnostic. when I asked what would fix the car, he said "I didn't dig that deep in to it."

I had already reached out to customer service before leaving this review and the response I received said all stores are independently owned. that's it.

resp.text: Meineke is all about trust, professionalism, and expertise. We're disappointed to hear you did not feel we lived up to this standard, Mellissa. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: Meineke took very good care of my car. And they listened to my concerns about my vehicle and addressed them. Very curtious and professional. I would trust them with my future auto needs.

resp.text: Thanks for putting your trust in our team, Lovely! If you ever need our services again, we'll be happy to see you.

name: Andrew Boutwell
text: Service was top notch! Great prices, friendly and prompt!! Highly recommend Meineke on S Parkway in Huntsville!

resp.text: We're glad you had a seamless experience with us, Andrew! We work hard to make sure you're getting the most value for your money. If you ever need our services again, we'll be happy to see you.

name: Michael Zemaitis
text: Waited one hour while AC was inspected. I was told compressor needed to be replaced and a kit installed. It would be $1,745.00 for all of that. I declined. Called Hyundai and spoke to service. Compressor replacement only $650.00 there.  Meineke is a rip off!

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know, Michael. Meineke is committed to saving you money: apart from helping you save with brake specials and auto repair deals, we aim to provide you with the highest quality repairs. You can always check https://www.meineke.com/coupons-and-deals to see our current coupons and discounts. If you have any other questions and concerns, we would be happy to hear from you at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/.

name: Pamela Johnson
text: I am  somewhat pleased with Meineke on South Parkway they do an excellent job Iwas some what please with hunter and the service I got done charged for my head lights being replaced  because they keep blowing out  so they changed me again plus there payment plain was a bit to high.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Pamela! Thanks for shouting out Hunter. We're all about getting car care right and are proud to be locally owned and operated. You can depend on us!

name: Savage Gambino
text: Hunter and Chris did a great job on our vehicle love the work they did i definitely will refer family and friends to them

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Savage! Thanks for shouting out Hunter and Chris. We're all about getting car care right and are proud to be locally owned and operated. You can depend on us!

name: Isaac Piper
