resp.text: Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. We're glad to hear about the great experience you had with our team. Thank you for sharing your experience, Isaac!

name: Phil King
text: The last 2 times I brought the car in for a job quoted as I could wait a couple hours they had it 7 days. This last time was 6 days for an oil pan gasket and I got it back with the check engine light on and NO oil!!!! When my wife showed this they tried to tell her it was the oil life and not the level.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with the work on your vehicle, Phil. Our goal is for every customer to drive off thrilled with the great work that we do. We'd like to look into this and see what went wrong. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to regain your trust and confidence.

name: Tina Hawkins
text: Let's see. I dropped my car off with no problems, just wanted a tune up. Get car back and check engine light is on. Cars run rough I was told I put bad gas in it. Find out they put bad spark  plugs on. Told they flushed coolant  but didnt.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with the work on your vehicle, Tina. Our goal is for every customer to drive off thrilled with the great work that we do. We'd like to look into this and see what went wrong. If you have any other questions and concerns, we would be happy to hear from you at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/.

name: Tia Wheeler
text: They were very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. As a woman, I felt respected. Good Covid19 precautions underway.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Tia! The safety of our customers and team members is always our first priority, and we are taking steps to protect the health and well-being of our team and customers. We have implemented a number of precautions based on the advice of the Centers for Disease Control, The World Health Organization and other health authorities to minimize the risk of transmission of COVID-19 for both team members and customers alike. You can continue to expect the same great level of service from us!

name: Alex Sims
text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. After a few hours, the work was done and they said they test drove my car to make sure it was working properly. I picked my car up right before they closed tonight and went on my way. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

resp.text: We understand your concerns, Alex. We want to make sure we are doing car care right. We are escalating your concerns internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to regain your trust and confidence.

name: Kathleen Mason
text: My radiator was leaking and I was having a hard time finding a place to fix it. They diagnosed it quickly and got a new radiator in the next morning (I first arrived 2 hours before close) and my car was fixed up before lunch the next day. They also did an oil change, replaced a filter, and looked at my tires. They had a shuttle also. Overall I was impressed.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Kathleen! We're glad to hear you had an easy and seamless experience. We're here to take all the stress out of auto services.

name: Robert Terry
text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

resp.text: Meineke is all about trust, professionalism, and expertise. We're disappointed to hear you did not feel we lived up to this standard, Robert. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

name: Bob Hatech
text: Andy and the team were efficient and friendly. My tires are rotated and oil changed correctly and at a good value to boot.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Bob. Thanks for shouting out Andy and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Jd Carroll
text: The professionals at Meineke are wonderful technicians. Every time I have a problem with my vehicle they are always there to help. Management is super nice and inviting and they always do a full inspection and let me know if there are other small issues and lay out good solutions while also giving me the option and not forcing a sale like other companies. I would highly recommend them for all your auto care needs.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team, Jd. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Sonny Norville
text: Had an exhaust leak and they replaced pipes and repaired as necessary. Excellent service and prices. Really like the guys!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Sonny! We're glad you had a good experience and came away happy with your car.

name: Steve Kirkpatrick
text: Took my truck in for air conditioning service recharge,  I had replaced the heater core, radiator, and all the assorted hoses, but the A/C needed complete  Servicing is it had been emptied. Store manager had quit recently and the district manager, Joe, was on site and had my trunk checked out only to find a faulty AC line that needed replacing before they could service my air conditioning system. They did all this at no charge. They could've just took my money and not fixed it, but I found the professionalism quite refreshing.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Steve. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Incog Nito
text: The people from the front desk to the mechanics were extremely knowledgeable and very polite and respectful. They were very fair in their pricing and took care of my problems very quickly. I'm very happy and recommend this to anyone.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the review. We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Michael Bass
text: It was a great experience the techs and the Manager there were very informative, knowledgeable and professional. The pricing was a bit of a tuff pill to swallow but they did a fantastic job and gave me a detailed inspection Of what else needs attention further down the road. Thanks guys for the outstanding work.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team, Michael. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Anthony
text: Staff took the time to explain everything in detail in a manner that anyone could understand. I appreciated being show what was wrong with my vehicle rather than just being told. It did take about 1.5 hours for an oil change, which I feel is quite longer than I expected or desired, but I am satisfied with the results

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Anthony! We're glad to hear you had a good experience with us. If you ever need auto services in the future, we hope you return so we can provide a 5-star experience.

name: Deb Walls
text: Prompt and friendly service! Kudos!

resp.text: Fast, friendly, and the best. That's what we're about! Thank you for the review, Deb.

text: Won't attempt my exhaust for the way I want it.

resp.text: Hi Kevin, we're disappointed to see that you had a subpar experience with us. You should always expect the best from Meineke. We would appreciate hearing any feedback you may have. You can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Carlos Alvarez
text: Great experience in all aspects! Well keep going back and recommend!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Carlos! We're glad you had a great experience with us. If you ever need work done or some car expertise, you know where to find us!

name: Monet Carroll
text: Great hospitality and service. As a college student, car maintenance can be a struggle, but I needed a lot of work done to my car. Specifically, I believe it was John and Justin who worked with me and my Dad. They threw in a few free services for us. Thank you!

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback! Thanks for shouting out John and Justin. We're all about getting car care right the first time and are proud to be locally owned and operated. You can depend on us!

name: Alexander Johnson
text:
Wonderful customer service for an extended repair process. Just had to get some seals in the transmission of my car replaced for a pretty penny, but the customer service and the transparency of Meineke made the process much more bearable.
They contacted me on a regular basis to tell me how the repairs were going and made sure to obtain my permission and input for additional repairs that cropped up during the repair process. Definitely will be using Meineke again for vehicle maintenance and repair.

resp.text: Keeping our customers fully informed throughout their visit is of the utmost importance to our team, Alexander, so we're glad you appreciated all of our updates. We appreciate your support on Google, and it's great to hear that this has earned your trust and future business!

name: Edwin Ponce
text: From the first contact by phone to the pickup of the car Craig treated me like a customer should be treated. He was naturally friendly and showed sincerity to help me. I had another offer from another shop I contacted before Craig but I chose him because I felt I could trust him to do a great job. I will recommend this shop to anyone because of Craig.

resp.text: From start to finish, our goal is to provide our customers with a positive experience, so we're overjoyed to receive this feedback, Edwin! Thank you for sharing your recommendation, and please feel free to reach out any time we can be of assistance.

name: mary taylor fontenot
text: Thad was very nice and professional. Him and his staff did a great job. The facility was super clean and organized. Overall I had a great experience.

resp.text: Thanks for putting your trust in our team, Mary! If you ever need our services again, we'll be happy to see you.

name: Christine Black
text: Out of state resident. Had an exhaust problem, thought could have cost me a fortune. I'm a girl with a Michigan plate. And they didn't take advantage of me. Huge props! Thad was the best! Oil change a little high, but that's what I get for running with synthetic oil. If ever a problem again, I'll be Back! Thanks Meineke. You Rock.

name: D H
text: Usually do all my own maintenance, but due to time and weather chose to give these guys a try based on good recommendations. Those good recommendations were well deserved in my opinion. These guys were competent, professional, and the service was a good value IMO. I will go there again.

resp.text: We greatly appreciate you sharing your positive experience! Our team works diligently to provide five-star service, and we hope you'll keep us in mind for anything your vehicle may need in the future.

name: rebecca lee
text: They fixed my front brakes quickly and at a great price.  This was my first time using Meineke and I was very impressed from start to finish. Curt was very courteous. I will definitely be back here in the future! Thank you

name: Pattycakes Dranks
text:
Came in about 5 in the afternoon for brakes issues. They checked the brakes for free gave me a killer estimate and got the job done in about 2 hours. They stayed past closing just for my car. The front desk person Alec was helpfully and very nice. The mechanic Andrew worked really hard and even kept me updated. Will come back because of those two.
Update. Went in for a simple oil change. Alec told me of the 20 dollar of deal and josh did the oil change. Good service again.

resp.text: Going above and beyond to provide efficient, reliable service is our mission, Patrick, so it's tremendous to hear we've earned your return! Thank you for your 5-stars, and we look forward to working with you next time.

This place sucks! I had to have all of their work done again, by another shop, 3 days later!! Bunch of shade tree mechanics.

STAY AWAY

text: I have never had such a great mechanic help me out. I had a very busy schedule with kids and work and they worked around me with no issues no attitude. Had my car fixed in 30 min and let me and the kids hang out in the lobby and were so sweet to them too. Thank you Craig your the bomb!

text: U had a few oil change that they said I could use but refused at time of service. Wasted an hour drive

text: I was pleasantly surprised that tire rotation is included with the cost of an oil change. The manager was very helpful and knowledgable and even fixed my tire for free when they found a nail in it. He also took a picture of the nail in my tire to prove it.

name: Joseph Patterson
text: Service was awesome and staff super friendly.

resp.text: You can always depend on us, Joe! We're glad you had a good experience. Thanks for the review.

name: Susan Redwine
text: I took my car in to the service department for a low tire. They told me I needed to have brakes put on the front and back. I trusted what they told me and decided to have them service my car. I started noticing problems with my brakes soon after. I took it back and they said they had put the wrong kind of pads on the front and it was going to be an additional $300 to fix it!  After paying them $800 for the new brakes 2 months ago! Do not trust them!!!

name: Tyler Schwinck
text: Highly recommend! They were extremely informative and helpful during my transmission and clutch replacement.

name: Russell Williams
text: This location is very close to us and the service rep took care of our needs quickly and the service was done in a prompt manner.

name: P Jane

text: They work with you and that is what separates them from the rest.

We really appreciate your kind words and will be sure to share it with our team. Whenever you need us, we're here to support!

name: Melissa Thompson
text: I was service with promptness & a smile got down to the problem with my vehicle!

name: Richard Bruce
text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. Your concerns are very important to us, and we're saddened to know this experience has jeopardized your future loyalty. Please allow us to allay your concerns by contacting our Customer Service team at 800-447-3070. Thank you.

name: Monicka Lemon
text: This is the first time that I came to this particular location. Over the phone we talked about a full synthetic oil change but when I went to pay, they just did a basic oil change and didn't put the next service sticker on the windshield. I probably won't go back to this location.

name: Ken Stone
text: Great customer service good quality work.

name: Cara Besch

text: Could not get ahold of them by phone. Called 800# and they could not help me, either. I ended up getting same work done cheaper at PepBoys. Answer your phone, Stupid!!

text: People were very nice, clean showroom and great prices!

name: Renae Wilkey
text:
Never again.

Almost 2 hours for an oil change when you are the only the only customer there.

I’ll give them credit for comping the service for me, but didn’t appreciate them saying it was because the wrong part was delivered, when I heard them order the filter for the wrong model vehicle and also never communicating that there would be a delay because they didn’t have the correct filter in stock.

Also, so much drama.

resp.text: It's disheartening to know that your visit did not exceed your expectations as we would have intended, Renae, as we would never want anything to deter you from returning for future services. We do not take your comments lightly, so we ask that you call our Customer Service at 800-447-3070 to allow us a chance to fully address your concerns. Thank you.

text: These mechanics are very poor. Probably decent people, but I had numerous problems after getting some work done. My vehicle is getting worked on elsewhere.

text: thanks Steve. great job. thanks for helping keep our granddaughter safe in her 2011 Toyota Corolla.

text: I arrived promptly at my appointment time of 8:30am. I didn't leave until 11:44am. Over 3 hours for an oil change and rear brakes. Absolutely unacceptable.

text: Everyone was very nice and said hello. Also explained where the refreshments were. Recommend. If you need/used car speech to George Jones, he's very nice.

text: I was there for an interview. Some people were a little " dry " and seemed too busy to bother with me. I felt out of place so I didn't even do the interview. Maybe if I was a customer I'd have been less of a problem for the desk guy  walking through the door. I saw a lot of people just relaxing on the phone up front so it seemed the ones in the back and outside were actually working. So see for yourself how you like it this is just my 1st and more than likely last experience at this place.

text: I had a marvelous experience yesterday at American Lube Fast. Garrett serviced my vehicle along with another gentleman and it was less about the oil change and more about the quality of customer service that made my experience great. Garrett went above and beyond and he even gave me a run down of what’s going on under my hood and that’s very valuable to me, especially as a young lady traveling around. I appreciated his level of expertise and efficiency, I will most definitely be coming back. Garrett needs to be promoted !!!!!!!!

resp.text: Nick is one of the best! You have made his day with your kind words. Thanks for your business and review. We appreciate you!

text: A sigh of relief to pull up a place to get you car serviced where they wear masks without you asking and discuss the cost upfront rather than up-charging you without your knowledge and hitting you with a bill at the end. Quick and thorough service with professional staff. Will be back for all my basic needs.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing this positive experience with us. We will get through this time together! Thank you for your business, and Happy Holidays!

text: The service people were great, easy to work with and informative about my car. Got in and out without any issues and at a fair price for what they did to my car.

text: This place will be honest with you even if you know nothing about cars. They're fast, cheap, and tell you only what you need. resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know that we have met your service expectations! Our team looks forward to seeing you next time, Ms. Dunning.

text: Garrett did a great job!!

name: danial pate
text: They wouldn't change my oil because of a small leak I have been putting off for a while. The employee told me there might be no reason to change my oil if it was leaking so bad. It only uses a quart between oil changes and I know how to check my own oil. I ended up changing my own oil and saving myself money anyway so thanks for that I guess. Still don't understand why they were making a big deal about an oil leak that consumes a quart between oil changes. I will never bring any of my vehicles to them again.

name: Katie Spotswood
text: These guys are great! I've been 3 times and still keep going back. Fast, friendly, respectable mechanics. The place is well run and they are always professional with whatever job they are doing!

text: Quoted one price then was charged another. If oli filter isn't included in the price... It should be. Other than that... very fast, friendly & professional service

text: They told my wife they couldn’t change the oil because we needed a new oil pan but our oil pan is new. They were rude to her so I called to see if I could sort it out and they proceeded to be rude to me. We will not be going back here

name: Justin Burns
text:
Had a slight issue with another store and was able to come here for fast, friendly and knowledgeable service that fit all my questions and concerns about my vehicle. I will use this location for now on for all my auto needs within there limitations.

Thanks guys!

JBurns

name: M Stevens
text: Typical fast lube place. Friendly service. Will try to upsale you on service you may or may not need.

name: T Potts
text: These folks take care of my vehicle and do a decent job of it

name: Jacob Kearley
text:
My wife brought my truck here today to get the oil changed. They were doing a light check (which from my experience with these types of places is routine) and they told her that the tail lights were out. Being the good wife she is, she was confused and asked for a person there to hold the break while she checked. The lights were (in fact) not on. Still in disbelief, she told the guy to step away and put her bag on the brake and lo and behold when she checked herself all lights worked!!!

They guy tried to act dumb and said there must have been a short when he checked it. She got back in the car and told the guy what an insignificant little ant he was and drove off. This company, not only this particular store will NEVER have my business again and I will let everyone know of this experience. They tried to take advantage of her being a female in her early 20s. If you ever come here make sure you talk to someone who has all their teeth and never let them "fix" anything!

name: Ice House Muzik
text: I came here with my friend to get oil change and had no idea we could stay in the car as the oil was being changed. Not only that the customer service was excellent. Learned stuff about the vehicle we never even knew. He made sure we knew what was happening and showed us that they had filled the oil back to full. Only took about 15 mins total. They have this way they talk to each other that is so cool.  Lol I'd refer them to any of my friends.

name: John Krahm
text: I was told that the threads on my oil pan were stripped and they could replace the oil pan for me.  It sounded suspicious so I said I would take it to the dealer.  They tried to convince me that was unnecessary and they could do the work for me.The next day at the dealer there was no problem with the threads and the price for the oil change was cheaper than the $65 LubeFast was going to charge me.

name: Mark Barber
text: always friendly fast and pressure free.

name: Steven Sparks
text:
My father and I have used these people for years. He owns a local company and has a fleet account with them. Well, this week, I have I took my Mustang (Hot-Rod crate engine) and they put cheap, super thin (5w20) oil in it. I just told them to but the best premium synthetic oil and the best oil filter they would sell me on it (and assumed they would put the correct oil to the engine). The next day, my new engine was knocking and they almost blew up my new engine from putting ridiculously thin oil in something that needs 10W30 or 10W40 oiland they put the cheapest oil filter on it you can buy. My father took his truck up there a week before to get transmission treatment and oil change. The next day the transmission fell out of the truck and he had to buy a new transmission. They also put way too small of an oil filter on his truck.

Basically, they use the cheapest stuff and charge you a premium price. They do terrible work, and they do not care what happens to your property. They are very pushy salesmen when it comes to the useless (or harmful) and overpriced additives that they want you to buy. I took my Mustang back to them and asked them to replace the oil with what it needs. They refused. I ended up being on the phone with the management and all I got offered was $20.00 off another oil change. The oil change they just have me with flushing out my coolant and oil and replacing coolent and the wrong oil was just over $200.00.  Needless to say, I change my own oil now and use Royal Purple oil (the best) and K&N oil filters. If you do it yourself, you know it is done right with the best parts and is cheaper. DO NOT USE LUBE FAST ANYWHERE, I went to the one one Opelika Road by the Grubmart gas station and the Tractor Supply store.

name: Loretta Smith
text: Nice guys, but was missing my cap from my tires.

name: Jeannie Miller
text: Awesome service! Polite, professional, fast, and the best price!

name: one neverwere
text: They lube fast!

name: Ac Blackmon
text: Motor just blew up.

name: Ian Smith
text: Got my oil changed, and had my headphones stolen

name: Anthony Hernandez
text: Couldn’t change my own oil because my tools are back home and I don’t have a space to do it, but this place was honest. I enjoyed the service.

resp.text: When we are providing a service that meets our customers' expectations, we celebrate! Thank you for your review and business.

name: Alycia E
text: Don't waste your time like I did. Instead just make the trip over to Honda in Columbus. The service will be top-notch. I travel constantly and have owned Honda's for 25 years. I have been to dealerships everywhere. I had a minor issue that could have been fixed quickly. Upon arriving at the run down shop the workers did everything they could to avoid acknowledging me. Wish I could have got his name specifically in the parts dept. He literally jumped on his cell phone when he saw me walk up. He didn't have a name tag on. Then I went into the service dept door and the man behind the counter has the audacity to tell me we MIGHT get you some time this afternoon. Mind you I'm traveling through which I mentioned, and I'm a single female. The issue literally just required a look at and some advice. Being in the medical field I understand being busy better then anyone. BUT there is never an excuse for being rude, and dismissive in business. I literally drive 45 mins to another dealership because you guys were so rude!

name: Jackenstein
text:
If you’re not sure, DO NOT come here!
Last week I stopped in the service department to ask if they would be able to fix my car’s broken sunroof seal. It is torn, off of its track, dry-rotted and very obviously needs replacing. The man at the front desk walks out with me to my car to see the problem and sees it as clearly as I could. We went back into the shop to set up an appointment that ended up being for a whole week later which was excessively long for the possibility of my car getting flooded if it rained. Today after the week had gone by, I took my car in told them my name and that I had an appointment, which they seemed not to even have on their books of me scheduling, asked for my address, phone number, and for the keys. Nearly 2 hours later I finally get a call back from them saying they didn’t have the part in stock, that they hadn’t done any kind of research on what my options were before my appointment (which we agreed they would do), told me they couldn’t get the seal as an individual part but would have to replace the whole sunroof instead, and that if I wanted that done it would be over $700 for it or if not that they would only charge $110 for running their “diagnostics”. A fee for “Diagnostics” to look at my car for no more than a minute to tell my seal had dry-rotted and needed replacing, really? It ended up being $117.70 after an additional charge of “supplies and/or hazardous waste removal” for a single floor mat, some identifying tags for my car and keys and some receipts. Not to mention there wasn’t a seat cover used despite their own disclosure sign saying they would be using them to slow the spread of coronavirus. I do not feel as though this charge was necessary and very much should have been avoided if they would done the work that was expected of them ahead of time. They will not be receiving any more of my business nor should they receive yours if your issue isn’t urgent or too difficult to do yourself.

name: Jennifer Keller
text:
I took my car to be serviced for three warning lights that repeatedly came on intermittently  (VSA, Power Steering and Emission). They stated it would cost $120 to diagnose the problem. Four hours later they called to tell me they found two pistons misfiring but it would cost another $120 to go any further to determine what was causing it.

I would give a negative number if possible. This service department is BY FAR the most dishonest service department with whom I have ever dealt in the past 34 years that I have been driving. I wouldn’t take my bicycle to them for repairs!!

name: Kati's World
text:
Back in February I brought my car in for just an oil change, but it ended up costing me over 400 dollars. However, I was willing to pay for it since I live over an hour and a half away, and it is a big deal for my car to be safe. Immediately after I left I noticed that wind was whistling through one of my doors and my brakes were squeaking. Then my radio completely stops working, and I decided to give this place another chance. We then brought my car in to get diagnosed, and were not made aware that they did not have a shuttle or anyway for us to leave the property besides uber.  After the diagnoses we got told by the service lady, to bring our car back in two days on Wednesday and that our rental would be free for two days, and that warranty would be covering the costs. Later that day we get a call from this same lady and in this call she tells us that my car would cost us at least 1800 dollars to get fixed, and that we had to pay for the rental car that we were driving. They also said that the pipe that needed to be fixed was bent in on purpose, and that we had done it (keep in mind that the only people who drive this car are two females who know nothing about cars). We were livid. They put the car back together and we got a second opinion, and turns out what they stated is wrong isn't.

The sales lady also reprimended a child for something she knew nothing about. I would give this place zero stars if I had the option. Overall, this is the worst experience I have ever had with a car place!

name: Joy Johnson
text: Feel like I got a good deal. Photo is of a different lot. But King got my business on this same model. Saved $875 off LaGrange Honda.

name: Justin Smith
text: Thank you Rodney for making the buying experience smooth and simple! I had a professional, businesslike experience and made a deal for my new Honda. The model I wanted wasn't available on the lot, so they picked it up and drove it in from Huntsville, keeping me informed every step of the way. Call Rodney at King Honda when you are in the market for your next vehicle.

name: Hobie Henning
text: Nice people, but it kinda feels like a used car dealership externally. It’s any to miss on the road. Just not as nice as the local Nissan or Toyota dealership

name: Philip Pantana
text: Worst experience I have ever had with an auto service dealership. This makes Honda look really bad.  Dropped my daughters car off via AAA tow on Monday and nothing has happened. Communication has been lacking when they said they would call me back they never would and has happened every day since then. Experience has made me feel like they’re trying to screw me over and rip me off

name: Anita Jones
text: Mr Shannon is one of the nicest people I have met while here in Auburn!  Anything you need done please go see him and his wonderful team!!!!!!!

name: kelvin james
text: Poor service sales man was awful

name: Granny Sandy Pouncey
text: Best auto repair shop around!  The only reason I drive a Honda is the shop.

name: Addison Weaver
text: Amazing customer service — thanks Ricky! Had a great experience when I brought my car in very last minute. They were able to figure out what was wrong and fix it pretty quickly. Overall a great place.

name: kelly brown
text: Jay Manning made the process very smooth from the beginning. Very professional, polite and was able to help me find my perfect car within minutes. I will be recommending King Honda to my family and friends.

name: evelyn hodges
text: Really appreciate Stacey W for getting my part secured in a hurry on a saturday! Very dependable!

name: Maggie McCoy
text: I've been going here for a number of years for service on my Honda. I don't have anything but good things to say about them! I've always had a great experience and they really value loyal customers. They've kept my car running in perfect condition and never made me feel like they were upselling anything or treating me like a woman who doesn't know anything (a rare quality in my experience with car service shops!). They always take time to explain to me what was done and why they did it. They clearly indicate the wear on each of the car components so that I have a record and can anticipate service that I might need in the future. I went to another Honda location once and they said I needed new brakes. They didn't give me any other reason than the service guy's opinion. I took my car to King Honda and told them that the other place had said I needed new brakes at my next visit. King Honda measured the wear and said it wasn't necessary based on the wear. I was very impressed by the fact that they went by the numbers rather than taking the chance to sell me some brakes that I didn't really need quite yet. Even after I moved away from Auburn, I still come back to get my car serviced here. Thanks to everyone there for keeping me a happy customer!

name: Odai Kouk
text: Horrible service.

name: Francois Bosman
text: Good car, Financing had a problem.

name: Shameera Turner
text: The service was great. I love the fact that they had a play area for my kiddos

name: Phyllis Nicholson
text: Great service on my car and friendly employee s

name: Grant Baldwin
text: Very unprofessional, kept my car 4 days past when they said it could be completed, changed my ignition switch/cylinder and broke my windshield switch and after said that there was no proof that they did it. I would not recommend this place to anybody save your time and money and get professional work and service from a better dealership.

name: Pamela Mears
text: You can't go wrong. These kind people aren't sales people. They are your friend for the day when you make a purchase. Reid is the man to see. He put my 17 year old in a low mileage dependable car. Danielle got the payments just right for me. I loved the experience so much... I'm going back to get a brand new civic. Thank you so much King!!

name: Joseph Cook
text: Pamela said it right, Reid was like a uncle or a long lost friend. Everyone is super nice and professional. The entire process was easy. I won't buy another car for a while but if I do, it will definitely by from King.

name: Jeremy Schill
text: They been building the new one for years

name: Birgit Turner
text: We used to take our Honda Accord to Honda Auto Nation in Columbus Ga., after having to deal with rude costumer service and them replacing my battery which was perfectly fine we changed to King Honda. Staff is very friendly and I wasn't pressured to have other work done than what I brought my Honda in for. Fast and friendly service, overall our experience was very good.

name: Melissa Atkinson
text: I only take my Honda’s here for service and it’s because the service department is fantastic! They address whatever concern I have and fox it the first time. Sometimes it’s a wait, but I typically just drop off because I know they can get behind. But really, I don’t mind waiting because I trust them and know they are taking great care of my vehicle

name: Denise P.
text: Best place to buy a new car!

name: Bullish Nole
text: Although we did not purchase a vehicle here I wanted to extend my thanks to the sales staff. They are very easy going and friendly. You can get a good deal without playing games. The GM is super nice and the service department is good also. I will continue to service my accord at King.

name: Sara A
text: I can't say enough good things about sales rep Clark Davis because he really cares about his customers. Without any obligation on my part, he let me take more than one car home with me overnight for my husband to check-out. In short, he is willing to work with people to find the right car at the right price.

name: Jade Irving
text: Service department is amazing here and sales was very helpful and not pushy! These guys took the burden of a bad local shop and did the best they could for me. I cannot emphasize how important it is to take your vehicle to a reputable place like this before taking it to a specialized place for repair. Save yourself the headache and use these guys, they know what they are doing and are very helpful!

name: denise pokorny
text: Candy was awesome again! We have purchased 2 cars from her 😊

name: King Honda
text: The worst dealership ever.  Bought a brand new, touring model Accord from them, and they can't keep my name or service records straight.  Service department does not want to help you with issues and is rude.   Waiting room is dirty, and staff from upstairs are running back and forth gossiping and being dramatic with each other. They will never have another sale from me.  If I could rate them less than one star, I would.

name: Amber Carroll
text: I bought my car last week from there. It was an amazing experience. Apply online and Candy Maynard is the online financing specialist. I truly recommend her she bent over backwards for me and I had never met her. When I got approved and I was told over the phone the amazing deal I got and when I got there it was all true. I truly LOVE this dealer and will be back.

name: Katherine Haas
text: As someone who dreads going to auto repair shops, I am happy to say that my experience at King Honda Auburn-Opelika was completely easy and stress-free. The staff was very nice and helpful, and I did not feel that I was being taken advantage of like I have at other auto shops. Great service!

name: Barış Köprülüoğlu
text:
Dealerships=Stealerships. King Honda is a good example of this fact.
My battery cable got corroded. I got my car towed to King Honda. It took them 4 days(!) to figure out the problem and they said the cable should be replaced which costs $260. I said no and got my car towed to Auburn Starters and Generators. They cleaned up the cable for $10 in 15 minutes and the car worked just fine. Honda didn’t even bother cleaning up the cable (which is something very easy for them to do) and charged me $60 diagnostic fee. STAY AWAY from King Honda! They will try to steal your money from the very first moment you walk into the service.

name: T Moraes
text: I came here to get my car serviced. They completed the service faster than anticipated and the staff were knowledgeable and friendly. They provided great customer service and they were very accommodating.

name: Amanda Moncus
text: I was seeking a used Honda Fit. Purchased a BRAND new 2016 Honda Fit for an EXCELLENT price!!! SPECIAL Thanks to RICKY WAVER/MARK SCHNEIDER/JEFF STEWART, MIKE SILVER, and all the Great staff here at King Honda for the WONDERFUL and PLEASANT experience!!! I am VERY Appreciative of them for helping me get a New Honda Fit! EXTREMELY SATISFIED‼️

name: Paggie Lim
text: just purchased my 2012 Honda Fit Sport from King Honda on 23 July 2016. LOVE TERRY!!! please ask for Terry if you happen to stop by. he was so helpful from start to finish. I just stopped by to look but ended up leaving with a car that I'm in love with!!!!

name: demarrick evans
text: We were very pleased with how we were treated at King Honda!  I didn't feel pressured to buy as I did at other dealerships.  Crystal, our salesperson, helped us tremendously, fought to get  us the best price.  I would recommend anyone looking for a car to stop by here.

name: Robert Litton
text:
Called to make an appointment to get a replacement key made for my truck. I asked very specifically how much it would be for a new key AND to have it programmed. I was quoted a price. I arrive at my appointment and they tell me it will be nearly double the price I was quoted AND they’d have to have my truck for 90 minutes.

I genuinely understand mistakes happen. But both of these problems could have been avoided with clear and accurate information. I had to walk home and not have my truck on my off day when I had errands to run. The service manager took $10 off, so I guess there’s that. I won’t be back.

name: Cody Cryer
text: I just bought a used Audi from King Honda, and had a very pleasant experience! Max Johnson helped me in the sales department from the start to finish and made sure I was completely satisfied with my purchase.  The service department was also a big help as well, Jacob Esco made sure my ride was in tip top shape before it was driven off the lot. 5/5 overall experience! If you are looking for a new or used ride, Max Johnson at King Honda is the guy to go to!

name: Jake Stewart
text: We purchased a used 2016 Honda from King.  After the sale, they disclosed that they didn't have the second key. Or the owners manual. Then we looked underneath the car and discovered various pieces of plastic missing and duct tape holding the remaining plastic onto the car. It took a few days, but they did rectify the plastic situation.  However, we still don't have the key or manual. The salesman was polite and made the repair process pretty simple.  Unfortunately, he didn't seem to know a single thing about our model of Honda. He wasn't able to answer many questions. I know Honda makes sales training manuals for each model. You should start using them, King. They are pleasant folks, but just do your due diligence and keep your eyes open.

name: Minehwa C
text: Josh at the parts department is extremely helpful.  I ordered a handle for my Odyssey from him.  I did not realize it is very involved to put the new handle on.  He helped me opened up the cover to get the screws out.  I was very happy with the service.

name: Destiny Smith
text: Went to the $79 sale and was told by an employee all that was needed was valid driver license!! Got down there and waited in line only to be told you have to have a down payment and excellent credit! False advertisement and a complete waste of time!

name: ang robinson
text: Great prices friendly staff. I will be back for my next car

name: TheFlashHayden
text: We have bought 3 cars now from this dealership.  My parents have bought from this dealership and my in laws have bought from this dealership.  Each time it has been a great experience!  Starting with the Sales Manger Kenny to the sales team of Shannon Culligan and Mike Pitts. These guys know how to work for YOU and not your money.  They genuinely try to help solve your particular problem or need without an end goal of just trying to SELL you a car.  No one these days want to be sold a car by someone.  They want to be guided in the right direction that best fits their needs.  That is what this team has done every time we have been there.  We live 2+ hours away now and will continue to make that trip back to Auburn/Opelika every time we need a car!  Thanks again guys!

name: Jennifer Spooner
text: This was one of the best buying experiences that I have had. Taylor was very accommodating. They gave me an awesome deal! Would recommend to everyone to go here and get a honda!

name: Bugman1324 Britt
text: Everything was great! Preston was fast and reliable with the services given to us today. Very much recommend this dealership to friends and family. Thank you so much for your help!

name: Gabe and Christina Arrington
text: Ask for Max when you go to King Honda!  He's the best person that we've ever dealt with when buying a car.  No hassles...he gave us a great price from the start, great value on our trade, and was even great with our kids!  Ask for Max!

name: Gabe and Christina Arrington
text: Ask for Max when you go to King Honda!  He's the best person that we've ever dealt with when buying a car.  No hassles...he gave us a great price from the start, great value on our trade, and was even great with our kids!  Ask for Max!

name: Bill L
text: I was there  for airbag recall, alignment and mount and balance of two tires. That's all I requested. They charged me twice what they said it would be for mount and balance two tires. $42 per tire in labor. They also changed the oil and topped floods which I did not request. I had done both myself less than a month ago so it did not need either. They charged me $15 for topping fluids and $35 for oil change. They removed the $35 from the bill. I didn't catch the other charges until I got home and was looking at the bill. Seems very deceitful to me.

name: Anthony
text: Great Sales Dept.  Andrew Reed gave me a great price on a new CR-V and I got a great offer for my trade in.  The experience was hassle free and I didn't have to deal with gimmicks!  Thank you King Honda!

name: Jennifer Spooner
text: This was one of the best buying experiences that I have had. Taylor was very accommodating. They gave me an awesome deal! Would recommend to everyone to go here and get a honda!

name: Chris W
text: I drove 50 miles to look at a Honda Odyssey and was extremely disappointed.  The salesman I first spoke to knew nothing about the product (I could forgive that because he was new to the job) so I asked to speak to a sales manager because I had some questions that the first guy couldn't answer.  The manager gave me a look like I was inconveniencing him (strike 1).  I asked him if he could give me some pricing options on a few models and he said it would be very difficult (funny...the Toyota guy gave me several different models with prices - strike 2).  I told the manager that I couldn't do business with him unless he could give me actual prices to compare and that he was competing for my business between a Toyota and Honda dealer to which he replied that he wasn't (strike 3).  What kind of manager doesn't think the customer has an option between car brands???  I've never met a sales staff that was not willing to work with a customer to provide every bit of information possible to make a sale.  It was like these guys wouldn't even talk to me unless I promised to buy a car from them on the spot...sorry I don't make $35k decisions on the spot!  I've also never met such a rude manager.  A good manager helps a customer and earns their trust.  If this is what you want, DON'T shop at King Honda in Auburn!

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Wife spends a lot of money here! GREAT  dealership

name: Sadegh Poozesh
text: I just got a Honda accord on this Jan. After 3 months one of the tires got leakage, I called them, but they don't take any responsibility even to check the tire. Although Honda is manufacturing great cars, but this is not a good dealership to purchase Honda cars from.

name: Paul_Melvin _
text:
Unfortunately the people working there seem NOT very nice AND their knowledge is lacking in terms of quality of tires for the cars.  It didn't seem to know the difference between the different ratings of higher quality and model brands of tires.  They seem kind of wishy-washy on their recommendations.
It appeared that they were just trying to push the tires that they have in stock which was a model of tire I didn't care for.
They also push for a lot of services that aren't required.
I question their ethics.
The entire service department smells badly.
Honda Corporation should question whether or not this dealership should maintain their franchise.

name: Jemall Finley
text: I hate when I feel like m being rushed off of the phone by a service adviser, very unprofessional. Called to get information about a nation wide recall on my ignition switch, i'm going to take my business to another Honda dealership

name: Benjamin Meade
text: As for the Service Dept: we have taken our car here for 5 years now and they have always been polite, professional and have taken good care of our vehicle. Great place to have a Honda serviced!

name: Joyce Nelson
text: High dollar cars not willing to work much with you

name: Caleb Barrow
text: I got my car serviced here and it was a very good experience. The staff was friendly, and I wasn't pressured to have any work done other than what I took it in for. I got an accurate estimate for my wait time. I imagine I will be back.

name: Anthony C.
text: Customer service is not a big thing here. I recommend go to either Columbus or Montgomery you may even get better deals definitely better customer service.

name: Sam Deal phone
text: Specifically about the parts department. Brought in a plastic piece that had popped off the hatchback. Guy came out, got the vin number. He and the lady spends 10-15 minutes looking on the computer. Comes back with, "we don't sell that part seperately. It is a component." Told them I found it online. They continued saying it wasn't in their catalog. Guy goes out and takes a picture of where the part was. That still doesn't help. Fortunately, I took a screen shot of the part I had found two days ago online. Called back, gave them the exact part number. It is now in their catalog. It is about 4 dollars more expensive to order it it online (with shipping costs), but would be worth it to avoid giving king honda a penny.

name: Kate Mel
text: King Honda Car World should change their method of operation.  Their method appears to be unethical, in that they pushed while appeared unnecessary service.  I.e., my tires needed to be changed immediately and transmission services, etc.  Additionally, once I received my vehicle back, I inspected and found several items that were functioning previously no longer functioning; such as, gas cap was loose which cause sensor malfunction, clock on the display was blinking as if they disconnected the battery, and the bluetooth include pandora was malfunctioning as well.  The overall experience was awful.  I will never bring my Honda to their service again.  Definitely not recommend this place to anyone.

name: Ryan Gaither
text: When I first walked in door I knew it didn't feel right. The lobby is non existent and the sales floor is outdated. It looks like a scene out of the movie Fargo where the sleazy car salesman works.  I was uncomfortable from when I arrived to when I told the salesman I was sorry I but I think I'll look elsewhere. He didn't take too kindly to that and pressured me to make a purchase because I otherwise wasted his precious time. He spent maybe 20 minutes putting together a quote for me. It was an all around bad experience.

name: Demita Preer
text: The service department is horrible. Drove 45 minutes to Auburn to get a second opinion on my car. Was told by a previous dealership that I was having engine issues. I was specific when I brought my car in for a diagnostic of what was told to me and also if it was the engine that I would not put any money in to the car, I would just get a new one. After sitting for two hours, I was told that it wasnt my engine that it was my timing chain. $1800 fix no problem, made my appointment to come back. Fast forward to appointment day, received a call from Buck in the service department stating that they fixed the timing chain, however they discovered issues with the engine. I was beyond furious. I specifically stated my concerns up front and you failed to do a proper diagnostic. After some back and forth they ate the costs and now I have to get a new car. Because of the horrible service in the service department, I will no longer be doing business with King Honda. It's sad because I really love their car salesman Shannon. I will be picking up my new car tomorrow from Lynch in Auburn.

name: Jonathan
text:
After having one of the worst experiences I have had at any dealership, I spoke with the manager at length.
The manager (Randall) explained the situation and offered any help he could. He also explained to me why the dealership was in ruins. They were moving to a brand new site in a few months. Their openness about their knowledge and non-pushy attitude allowed me to reach a decision. Their service department was extremely knowledgeable and forth coming about any answers I needed. Their detail department is also to consider. While hidden and a little run down, they work hard on any project at %110.

If I have learned anything, never let a first appearance or situation judge the entire lot. Always give a 2nd chance.

name: Mclovin Wilson
text:
I have been using them for a year or so for service. No complements but no complaints either. Then I needed a key. They ordered it and called about a month later. I never followed up so I assume the long time was that it slid through the cracks for both of us. Made an APPOINTMENT to get the new key cut for 2pm. Showed up at 2pm and was told it was going to be an hour or more before they could even get to my key. I was told that an appointment was a time to see a service adviser, the time has nothing to do when they would get to my car.
I had other things to do and said call when you can get to my car and I will come back.
Next day a lady calls and asks very rudely what I want to do with the key. I say that I value my time more than them, call me when you can actually work on the key or return it. She said it was being shipped back and immediately hung up on me.
I would stay away. Drive the 40 minutes either direction to  dealer that does not take the small town auburn family for granted. Any King dealership is out in my book.

name: Tizzo Heavy
text: Ok dealership. Service department has good techs but can be sketchy when it comes to fees on repairs. Get everything in writing.

name: Hilliary Sanders
text: In my opinion, King Honda is the worst dealership in the area.  After our first sales person left, I had to contact another sales person who happened to be the sales manager regarding a Honda Pilot that I was interested in buying.  The new sales person, test drove my current vehicle (Jeep Liberty), gave us a trade-in price, negotiated the numbers, wrote up all the paperwork on the new vehicle and said congratulations, it’s yours, hand shake, done deal.  NOPE, I go home, switch out all my personal items, bring back my Jeep only to be told that they made a mistake on the trade-in price of my Jeep, and that I would need to pay them $3000 more or give the Honda Pilot back....which I did and they sold it to another lady waiting to buy it that day!  How convenient.  Buying a car is supposed to be a joyous experience, and this experience was anything but!  I was so hurt, I had to wait several days before I was able to even speak about the situation.  My intentions for this review is to inform potential buyers that they should be proceed with caution when dealing with King Honda of Auburn!  -Genia B.

name: James Durand
text: They got the work done but they were unnecessarily pushy of services. They read my mileage wrong and told me I missed all of my major maintenance because of it. After I showed them they had done that wrong they grudgingly admitted I was doing things correctly. They also changed all of my settings in my car from the radio to the steering wheel and seat for 20 minutes worth of work. Finally they didn't acknowledge my wife as a car owner. They directed all questions about her car to me which seemed very inappropriate.

name: William Sharpe
text: Very helpful and nice but didn't find exactly what we needed.  Check them out.

name: Shinan Kassam
text:
Questionable service rendered. I seriously doubt they actually perform service that they say they perform. Every service our tires supposedly  get "rotated, aligned and balanced". After 30K miles there was extremely uneven wear on the front tires.

Also they claim to refill fluids. In this case they told us we completely ran out of washer fluid between oil changes, which we did not. Going elsewhere. Stay away! They are crooks.

name: Brandi Tate
text: I purchased my Honda accord from King Honda about four years ago.  Since then, I never came back to the dealership for anything until I received a recall on my car.  Along with the recall job, I was told that I needed additional work that totaled to $698.  I paid and a week later saw that I needed an oil change.  I received a oil change coupon through email.  I made an appointment to get my oil changed and told the lady that it came from my email.  On the day of my appointment (which I took off work to come to), I was told that I could not use the email that was on my phone and that I had to print it off if I wanted the service.  The guy's tone was not welcoming and he did not try to solve my problem.  I work in customer service and there is always something you can do for a customer that just spent almost $700 with you. I don't think I will return and I will not tell anyone they should come to your dealership because some of your employees don't value their customers.

name: Lindsay Durand
text: Not in the nicest neighborhood. I brought in 2 cars at once for an oil change and the staff seemed confused by 2 cars. Told me I had 30,000+ miles my car with 15,000 miles and tried to pressure me into doing normal 30,000 maintenance. When I refused because I knew I was not at 30,000 they then tried to tell me I was a bad and irresponsible driver. I made someone come out and look at the miles on my car to prove I was only at 15,000. He said that the guys in the garage must of screwed up and walked away. Never apologized for the awful things he said when he thought I wasn't doing required maintenance.

name: Christian Foster
text:
Brought my car in to have I looked at for a clanking noise. Was told it was going to be looked at. The year of my car was specified at drop off. Found out later that my car needed an axle replaced(which is understandable) and that there was a recall on an airbag. I should have been told upfront that my vehicle had a recall because now that it has been dropped off I can't have my car for several weeks due to liability. Then I also wasn't told up front that I couldn't have a loaner during the time period because I am 20 not 21. Now I am without a car for several weeks and I should have been told these things I would have to deal with up front so I could have planned around it.

I WOULD NOT RECCOMEND KING HONDA CAR WORLD.

name: Mike Tucker
text: Have had experiences with the service department only.  First time a couple of years ago I had the transmission fluid and filter changed on my Ridgeline and the price and service was acceptable.  The second time i needed the timing belt changed.  I got a quote from them for $1650 (ouch) but this included a number of other items that are listed by the "Maintenance Minder" plus more.  I then asked for only the timing belt and it was quoted as $700 (again ouch).  Also said it would take 1.5 days...hhhmm.  I have had this done on on the the same engine in a Pilot a few years back and it was less than $400 so I called McConnell Honda in Montgomery.  They quoted $460 and only 5hrs!  Well guess where I went!  How can Honda service centers less than one hour from each other be so different.  Obviously McConnell has something figured out that King does not!  Will NOT be taking my Hondas to King!

name: Dennis Kmiec
text: A dead AC in early July on vacation is a helpless feeling. Turned out it was still under warranty and 4 hours later we were cool again. Though we had to wait a few days to bring it in, we weren't going anywhere and they're next to a fine barbecue. And though I had to pay for the diagnosis. I wasn't going to argue.

name: Joe Carlson
text:
We had both a bad sales AND service experience.  We wound up buying a Honda Odyssey EX-L elsewhere.  We do everything we can to have all service on the vehicle done elsewhere, too.

Stay away.  In my opinion, it's hard to do worse than King Honda in Auburn.

name: Millionnah Thompson
text: Purchased a certified used 2009 Honda Accord EX-L in 2011 that had 20 something thousand miles on it. First off, the car is beautiful!  But over time and realizing that it has been burning oil and has horrible grinding (vtc actuator defect) when I start it,  I have realized that the motor is complete junk! My factory window tint is so bubbled that I can't see out of my back window, poor windshield visibility in the rain, leather on the door panels and center console is coming apart, transmission sounds like it slips and does not want to change out gears, absolutely no power when you are merging into traffic or at initial take off so bad that I basically have to floor it and it jumps to 6/7 thousand rpms and on top of it all my sun roof leaks!!!!  There have been so many service bulletins posted about defective parts that it is ridiculous!! I did the recommended oil consumption test and within 2 months my oil wasn't even touching the dip stick!! I am supposed to be getting my pistons and rings replaced as well as numerous other things (NOT by King Honda) but American Honda will not cover the cost for their KNOWN defects with certain parts and it makes me sick to know that I only have 107 thousand miles on my car and 7 months left to pay on this piece of worthless trash and I'm at a total loss basically!! The best way to waste $22,500 is to go throw it away on one of King Honda's vehicles! I will NEVER own a Honda again!! I can't wait to get a TOYOTA 4-RUNNER after I finish throwing away my money on this POS!!!

name: Hamza Alkhudaidi
text: Always good service with them! Highly trusted employees

name: Sam Bartlett
text: Worked with me when my newly leased car had it's windshield crack after less than a week, and didn't try to get me into more car than I could afford. Friendly staff, very down to earth people.

name: Debbie Turnbloom
text: They baited me with a a CRV that had navi. I had paperwork drawn up for a loan at my credit union in chelsea. king had already sent my credit union the bill of sale on the car with the right vin and then called me and backed out on the deal just a few hours before I was driving to auburn with the check.  They said they could not sell the car at that price with navi. I said that was the deal we agreed on, shook on and I had the paperwork for. Then the sales manager Randall argued with me telling me that I WAS BEING DISHONEST in wanting them to keep the deal they agreed to because they had made an honest mistake.

name: Carmen Smith
text:
In 2013, I purchased my 2013 Honda Accord from King Honda of Auburn. I must say, that the service rendered was indeed, "service with a smile." After my delightful purchasing experience, I returned to my hometown approximately 41 miles west of Auburn and elected to, for the sake of time, have all my service needs performed by the local Honda dealership nearest me. This would be the trend for the next couple of years until I started experiencing a problem with my keyless ignition system. Time and time again, I would go in to this local certified Honda dealership and my problem was never resolved. I was even told by them that the only way they could get to the root of my problem was that my car would have to stop working completely. Well needless to say, this caused me extreme stress and anxiety. At this moment, I picked up the phone and gave Mr. Dave King of King Honda Auburn a call. Immediately, he pledged his absolute commitment to working with Service Manager Randy Melius and the other dedicated service professionals to identify and fix my ignition problems. Within two days of making contact with Mr. Dave King and getting my car to King Honda of Auburn, my fears subsided. His service team did just what was assured to me. I am no longer living in fear of my car not starting which compromised the safety my family and me.

In closing, please know that the automotive professionals of King Honda of Auburn will be there for you years after the ink dries on your purchasing contract. Words could never express my appreciation to owner, Mr. Dave King, service manager, Randy Melius, and their bonafide service professionals for their commitment to meeting the needs of their customers!!

name: Austin Texas
text:
Wednesday 3/15/2017 @ 3:30p = 1-star
=========

If you readers out there own a honda automobile  and want to do a service here then you should think harder...

I am visiting my college kid here at Auburn and own a 2014 Honda Accord-EX.  The vehicle still have 40% life of oil before the next oil change.  Since I live some 900 miles away from Auburn and not sure when is the next time I'll be here.  But I want to get the oil change for my kid before I leave Auburn.  I came in the dealer at 3:30p and since this dealer is the smallest honda car dealer and pretty confusing if you are the first time visiting the service (no sign or direction to the service dept).  At 3:45p, I entered the door to the service counter and saw two man sat by the counter texting on their phone and asking him (buck is the name) if it is ok that I can do a quick oil change.  His replied was "we are closing at 5:00p and we are wrapping up so no more service for the day" I told him you have at least 1hr 10min left.  He notch his head but we are closing.

I laughed so hard because this honda service dealer is so much unfriendly and not willing.  How can you show up to work and not working?  Something is really wrong here.

I am writing to share my bad experience at "king honda service dept" so reader out there to save your time, energy and money else where you and the service you like other than king honda.

On my way out I stopped by the front sale office and share my experienced to mr. Randall / GM.  He seems to acknowledge my concerns and took down my contact info.

I took my business to "Express oil Change" 3min away from king honda dealer and they really treating me like a real customer.  My fav guys are Michael and Zack.

UPDATES...3/15/2017 @ 5:47p = 4-stars
========
I received a phone call from Mr. Dave King (the owner).  He first introduced himself and sincerely apologized to me of his service dept staffs behavior.  I have to give Mr. Dave King a lot of credit to reaching out to me as a upset customer and asked me to come back to his dealer to offer to do oil change if I havent done it (he actually said he would do it him self).  That enough to tell me that he genuinely care.  Instead he offered a certificate of free oil change on our next visit.

I want to thanks Mr. Dave King and Mr Randall for their action and care to their customers.

Because of these efforts I have decided to move my rating from 1-star to 4-stars.

name: Jerome Stinson
text: The service department is horrible!!!! I went there for an oil change and i ask the guy who you check in with at the service department  desk does all the fluid be top off he said yes. So after bout an hour and half they brought me my receipt and they said they was finish and I ask did they top off all the fluids again and he said yes. (With me knowing my coolant and power steering was low). So when I paid I proceeded to go outside and raise my hood and what ya know my fluids are still at the same level and I went back inside and told the sales rep. in which he then called the mechanic who did the work and he seen for his self he half ass the job (but I got a check list that all of that was done). But one of my relatives had experience the same thing a couple of months ago. It's a shame that you have to check behind someone if they say the job is done. BUT I WILL NEVER GO BACK AND WILL BE CHANGING SERVICE DEALERSHIP.

Did business with George this week for the first time. He did good work. Glad to have someone who cares taking care of my truck locally.
4/6 update - just had George do some more work on our commercial vehicle. He did a great job again.

text: I own a older model vehicle and parts can sometimes be hard to get or have to be ordered. But Popwell had me back on the road the very next day. Would definitely recommend to others.
